name: Aardwolf
description:
The aardwolf has a yellowish coat with a black stripe running along the back and extending to the tip of the tail. 
Three black stripes run vertically along its sides. 
The aardwolf also has stripes on its legs. 
Length:85-105 cm
Height: 40-50cm
Weight: 8-12kg
After a gestation period of 2-3 months, females give birth to 2-4 cubs. 
Interesting Fact: Aardwolves have been known to consume up to 200,000 termites in a single night.
Found In: Grasslands, savannas, scrub and rocky areas.

name: Admiral
description:
This butterfly has scales on its four wings, clubs on the ends of its antennae, and a coiled proboscis.
Length: wingspan 55-65mm
Butterflies usually start courting as soon as they are able to fly. Eggs are laid on plants, typically on the underside of leaves.
Interesting Fact: There are over 20,000 known butterfly species.
Found In: Flowery banks, Woodland boarders.

name: African black crake
description:
The black crake is black with a bright yellowish-green bill and red legs.
Length: 20-22cm
Weight: 100g
Females lay 3-6 eggs.
Interesting Fact: Not all the chicks will hatch at the same time, but they leave the nest soon after hatching.
 Found In: Freshwater marshes, swamps, lakesides.

name: African buffalo
description:
The coat of the African buffalo is short and can vary from red to black. It also has thick, bossed horns.
Height: 120cm
Weight: 320kg
A cow will produce a single calf after a gestation period of 11 months. She has a new calf every two years.
Interesting Fact: The African buffalo's poor eyesight and hearing is made up for by its strong sense of smell.
Found In: Forests to semi-deserts.

name: African bush squirrel
description:
The African bush squirrel has variable coat colorations with white to yellow underparts.
 Length: 13-19cm
Weight: 100-260g
Interesting Facts:African bush squirrels are the largest, most diverse and adaptable of all African squirrels.
 Found In: Woodlands and thickets

name: African clawless otter
description:
The African clawless otter is dark brown with white tipping. Its cheeks and neck are white, and it has small claws on the third and fourth toes of the hind feet only.
Length: 95-100cm
Weight: 12-21kg
Interesting Fact: As with most otters, African clawless otters are very skillful with their hands.
Found In: Streams, pools, coastal waters, estuaries

name: African darter
description:
The African darter has a long neck and tail and a sharp pointed bill. The crown of the male and the back of his neck is black and chestnut.
Length: 85-97cm
Weight: 1058-1815g
Interesting Fact: African darters are also called snake-birds because they often swim with their body fully submerged and their long, thin neck protruding out of the water.
Found In: Lakes, pools, lagoons, and marshes

name: African elephant
description:
The African elephant has a trunk with two tusks to either side. It has large ears.
Height: 1.6-2.8m
Weight: 900-3500kg
A single calf is born after a gestation period of 22 months.
Interesting Fact: The large, highly vascularized ears are used as a cooling system.
 Found In: Variable habitats containing water.

name: African fish eagle
description:
The African fish eagle has a white head, chest, tail, and back. Its feathers and scapulars are black. The abdomen and wing coverts are chestnut.
Length: 74-84cm
Interesting Facts:The vocalization of the African fish eagle is so well-known and clear, it is sometimes referred to as the 'voice of Africa'.
Found In: Lakes, rivers, coastal lagoons, mangrove swamps

name: African ground squirrel
description:
The African ground squirrel has coarse hair that is a brownish to reddish-gray color. Its underparts are buff to white.
Length: 20-46cm
Weight: 300-945g
Interesting Fact: South Africans often keep African ground squirrels in their homes as pets.
Found In: Woodlands, grasslands, rocky country

name: African jacana
description:
The African jacana has a brown body with a bright blue frontal shield and beak. They have extremely long toes and a white foreneck and face.
Length: 30cm
The female lays four eggs. Males are responsible for incubating the eggs for 25 days while the female moves on to mate with 2-3 other males
Interesting Facts:The long toes of the jacana are used to walk on floating vegetation such as lily pads.
Found In: Tropical wetlands, marshes, rivers, lakes

name: African lion
description:
The coat of the African lion varies from white to yellowish brown. A tawny-yellow is most common.
Length: Male: 172-250cm, Female: 158-192cm
Height: 100-128cm
Weight: Male: 150-260kg, Female: 122-182kg
Litters of 2-6 cubs are produced after a gestation period of 100 days.
Interesting Fact: On a still night, an African lion's roar can be heard from 8 km away.

name: African lynx (Caracal)
description:
The caracal has a reddish-brown to yellow-gray coat, white undersides, tufted ears, and long legs.
Length: 55-75cm
Height: 43cm
Weight: 16-23kg
The gestation period for caracals is 70-75 days long. One to four cubs are born and are weaned six months after birth.
Interesting Fact: Possibly the best hunter known, caracals have amazing speed, agility, balance, and are expert jumpers. They can hurl themselves several feet off the ground to snatch small birds from the air and are swift enough to catch several birds in one leap.
Found In: Savannas, open plains, semi deserts, sand deserts.

name: African pied wagtail
description:
The wagtail has black upperparts, white wings, and a black U-shaped breast band joining with black ear coverts. There is also a white patch on the sides of the neck.
Length: 18.5-19cm

name: African polecat
description:
The African polecat is mostly black with white stripes and a white tail. Their underside is black.
Length: 30-38cm
Height: 10-15cm
Weight: 600-1400g
Interesting Fact: As a defense mechanism, the polecat will spray its aggressor with a foul-smelling fluid from its anal glands.
Found In: Grasslands, steppes

name: African porcupine
description:
The crested porcupine has black and white quills along its back and neck. The quills are erectile and can be up to 50 cm long. The porcupine's underside is covered with dark bristles.
Length: 63-73cm
Weight: 8-23kg
A female, after a gestation period of 107-112 days, will bear 1-3 young during the wet season.
Interesting Fact: Crested porcupines are born with soft quills that harden within hours after birth.
Found In: Forests, savannas.

name: African red-eyed bulbul
description:
The African red-eyed bulbul is sooty brown above and has a black head and throat. The underside is light brown with a whitish lower belly. The undertail coverts are yellow, and there is a red wattle around the eyes.
Length: 20cm
Found In: Bush country, riverine forests.

name: African skink
description:
The African skink has a slender body and pointed head. Its coloration and markings are highly variable.
Length: up to 30cm

name: African wild cat
description:
The color of the Cape wild cat is variable: gray, tan, orange, or black. It has dark stripes on the upper legs, fainter stripes on the body, rings around its tail, and a lighter underside.
Length: 51-63cm
Weight: 3-8Kg
After a gestation period of 56-60 days, the female gives birth to 2-5 kittens.
Found In: Varied, including urban areas

name: African wild dog
description:
The African wild dog's coat has blotches of black, white, tan and brown. Its muzzle is black, and its ears are rounded. The wild dog has a tufted tail with a white tip.
Length: 76-112cm
Height: 75cm
Weight: 18-36kg
African wild dogs breed in the late rainy season. As many as 16 puppies are born after a gestation period of 69-72 days
Found In: Woodlands, savannas, grasslands, steppes

name: Agama lizard
description:
The Agama lizard's head, neck and thighs are covered with spiny scales. Males can be brown, gray, red, blue, or even yellow. Females, however, are either brown or gray in color
Length: up to 40cm
Agama lizards are egg-layers, with clutch sizes of 2-20 eggs.
Interesting Fact: There are 60 known species of agama lizards.
Found In: Dry habitats along forest edges, sand deserts, rocky areas, mountains.

name: Agile wallaby
description:
The agile wallaby of Australia has sandy or golden brown fur. Its hip and cheek stripes are white. They also have short ears.
Length: male: 715-850mm, female: 593-722mm
Weight: male: 16-27kg, female: 9-15kg
Interesting Fact: These animals are considered pests because they commonly feed on crops and in pastures.
Found In: Wet tropics, lowlands.

name: Agouti
description:
Agoutis can be orange, brown, or black in color. The underside is most likely black with yellow or white. The rump is a contrasting color.
Length: 41-62cm
Agoutis mate twice a year, giving birth to 2-4 young each time.
Interesting Fact: Agoutis can jump as high as two meters vertically into the air.
Found In: Forests, savannas

name: Albatross
locations: Central parts of Western South America
description:
The waved albatross has black wings and saddle, white plumage, and an orange hooked bill. The feet are blue in color.
Weight: 3-5kg
Found In: Oceans, coasts, coastal islands.

name: Alligator
description:
The American alligator is generally black with yellowish cross bands that become less apparent with age.
Length: 3-6m
Interesting Fact: The main difference between a crocodile and an alligator is that, in an alligator, the fourth tooth on each side of the lower jaw is not visible when the mouth is closed.
Found In: Freshwater ponds, lakes, rivers, swamps.

name: Alpaca
description:
Alpacas are either uniformly colored or multicolored with white, brown, gray, and/or black hair.
Length: 120-225cm
Height: 94-104cm
Weight: 55-65kg
Found In: Alpine grasslands, meadows, marshes.

name: American Virginia opossum
description:
The American Virginia opossum's color can vary from light gray to brown.
Length: 32.5-50cm
Weight: 2-5.5kg
Found In: Forests, scrublands, grasslands.

name: American badger
description:
The top of the American badger's body is gray to reddish in color. Its underside is yellowish. The badger's feet are dark brown or black. A white stripe runs down the center of the head from the shoulders to the nose.
Length: 42-72cm
Weight: 3.5-12kg
Interesting Fact: The American badger is the Wisconsin state animal.
Found In: Arid grasslands, burrows underground.

name: American beaver
description:
Beavers have a dense, dark brown fur. Their feet are webbed.
Length: .7-1.3m
Height: 30-60cm
Weight: 27kg
Interesting Fact: Beavers are the largest of all rodents found in North America.
Found In: Rivers and lakes in woodlands.

name: American bighorn sheep
description:
The American bighorn sheep is brown with white rump patches. Both sexes have horns; however, males have larger and more spiraled horns.
Length: 168-186cm
Height: 94-110cm
Weight: 57-140kg
Females gestate for 175 days before giving birth to one or two lambs.
Found In: High mountain pastures.

name: American bison
description:
The American bison has a brown coat with longer hair on its head, shoulders, and forelegs.
Length: 2.1-3.5m
Height: 152-182cm
Weight: 545-818kg
Found In: Grasslands, forests.

name: American black bear
description:
American black bears are primarily black, but they may be brown, cinnamon, pale blue, or white. A white patch on the chest is also common.
Length: 130-190cm
Weight: male: 60-300kg, female: 40-80kg
Found In: Forests, tundra.

name: American crow
description:
The house crow has black body feathers glossed with metallic violet. Its wings are black with a green-violet gloss, and the eyes are brown.
Length: 43-53cm
Weight: 500g
Breeding pairs of this species may mate for life. Each pair lays 4-6 eggs beteen February and June.
Interesting Fact: If threatened by a hawk or owl, flocks of crows will attack the larger predator.
Found In: Woodlands, rural and urban areas

name: American marten
description:
The American marten has a long, slender body and a pointed face. Its tail is bushy, and the body is dark brown in color.
Length: 30-45cm
Weight: .5-1.5kg
Interesting Fact: The fisher, one of the eight marten species, has developed a way of defeating the porcupine, an animal with a perfect defense mechanism. It directs its attack to the porcupine's face, the area that is not protected.
Found In: Forests, woodlands.

name: American woodcock
description:
The American woodcock is a very chunky bird with short legs and neck. It has a long bill and eyes close to the back of its head.
Length: 28-35cm
Found In: Mixed forests and open fields.

name: Anaconda
description:
Length: 2-9m
Anacondas are ovoviviparous, giving birth to several dozen young at a time
Interesting Fact: Adult snakes of the larger species are capable of killing humans.
Found In: River valleys, swamps, marshes.

name: Andean goose
locations: Eastern parts of Central South America
description:
The Andean goose has mostly white feathers. It has a coral red bill with a black tip.
Andean geese form life-long pairs.
Found In: Marshy plains, damp meadows, mountain valleys, lakes, lagoons.

name: Australian spiny anteater
description:
The coat of the short-beaked echidna is black to light. It has spines on its back and sides, and the snout is long, narrow, and naked.
Length: 30-45cm
Weight: 3.5-8kg
Found In: Grasslands, forests.

name: Anteater
description:
The coat of the giant anteater is gray-brown with a diagonal black and white shoulder stripe. The tail is long and bushy, and the foreclaws are long and powerful.
Length: 1-1.2m
Interesting Fact: Female anteaters give birth standing on their hind legs, using their tails as third legs for support.
Found In: Forests, savannas.

name: Antechinus
description:
The brown antechinus is light brown in color above and flecked with buff. It is paler in color below and on its tail.
Length: 10-12cm
Weight: 18-60g
Interesting Fact: Males die shortly after mating.
Found In: Forests.

name: Antelope ground squirrel
description:
The antelope ground squirrel has light brown fur with white stripes on each side of its body. The undertail is either gray or white.
Length: 218-240mm
Weight: 130-170g
Interesting Fact: Antelope ground squirrels build complex underground tunnels that have multiple chambers.
Found In: Grasslands

name: Arctic fox
description:
The Arctic fox has a white or blue winter coat and a dingy brown coat in the summer. They have rounded ears, black eyes, and a short black nose.
Length: 50-60cm
Height: 28cm
Weight: 2.5-5kg
Interesting Fact: A fox's thick winter coat helps keep its body temperature near 100 degrees.
Found In: Tundra.

name: Arctic ground squirrel
description:
The Arctic ground squirrel has a beige or tan coat. They have white spots on their back, a dark bushy tail, and white markings around their eyes.
Length: 39cm
Weight: 700-800g
Interesting Fact: As much as 40 percent of a squirrel's body weight can be lost during hibernation.
Found In: Arctic tundra.

name: Arctic hare
description:
The Arctic hare has elongated and curved claws on the forefeet. They have a white winter coat with black ear tips. In the summer their coat color becomes brownish gray.
Weight: 3.2-5.4kg
Interesting Fact: Arctic hares can run as fast as 64mph.
Found In: Tundra, mountains, lowlands.

name: Arctic tern
description:
The Arctic tern has a deeply forked tail, white and black cap, pale gray back and wings, gray underparts, and a red bill.
Length: 36-43cm
Interesting Fact: This bird migrates farther than any other bird species - from the high Arctic to Antarctica.
Found In: Coasts, tundra, open oceans.

name: Asian elephant
description:
Asian elephants have thick skin and three hind foot nails. Females, unlike males, do not have tusks.
Length: 550-640cm
Height: 250-300cm
A single calf is born after gestation period of 18-22 months.
Interesting Fact: Asian elephants have much smaller ears than African elephants.

name: Asian forest tortoise
description:
The Burmese brown mountain tortoise's carapace usually is light to dark brown in color.
Length: 60cm
Weight: 45kg
Interesting Fact: The Burmese brown mountain tortoise is the fourth largest tortoise in the world.
Found In: moist broadlead forests that are influenced by monsoon rains.

name: Asian lion
description:
The Asian lion has a thick coat with a long belly fringe. The male's mane can be tawny to reddish-brown or even black. The Asian lion's body color is tawny with white undersides, and the back of the ears are black.
Length: Male: 2.6-3.3m; female: 2.4-2.7m
Height: Male: 1.2m; female: 1.1m
Weight: Male: 150-240kg; female: 122-182kg
Found In: Forest

name: Asian openbill
description:
The Asian openbill is generally white or grayish-white. Its flight feathers and tail are black, and the legs are dull pink.
Length: 68cm
Found In: Inland wetlands.

name: Asian red fox
description:
The coloring of an Asian red fox can vary from pale yellowish-red to deep reddish-brown.
Length: 45-84cm
Weight: 4-5kg
Found In: Woodlands, open country, urban areas.

name: Asian water buffalo
description:
The hair of the water buffalo is sparse and colored charcoal gray to black, with dirty white lower limbs. The large crescent-shaped horns are slightly upturned.
Length: 2.5-3m
Height: 1.5-1.8m
Weight: 800-1200kg
Interesting Fact: At 1.2 meters across, the water buffalo has the largest horn span of all bovids.
Found In: Wet grasslands, marshes, pools, wallows, rivers, woodlands.

name: Asian water dragon
description:
The Asian water dragon is green in color. It has a vertebral crest and light body bands on its sides.
Length: 60-76cm
Females dig a deep nest and lay 8-14 eggs.
Found In: Tropical rainforests.

name: Asiatic jackal
description:
The coat of the golden jackal is either pale golden brown or yellow tipped with brown. The underside is more pale and the tip of the tail is black.
Length: 60-106cm
Height: 38-50cm
Weight: 7-15kg
Found In: Open country with trees and brush.

name: Asiatic wild ass
description:
The onager is gray to fawn in color.
Length: almost 2m
Found In: Steppes, gorges, river margins.

name: Australian brush turkey
description:
The male Australian brush turkey has a black bill, bare red skin on its head, neck, crown, and nape, and a large yellow collar and wattle.
Length: 70cm
Weight: 1.8kg
Interesting Fact: Brush turkeys use their tongue to test the temperature of their nests.
Found In: Rainforests, wet open forests, dry inland areas.

name: Australian magpie
description:
The black-backed magpie is black with a wide white collar, shoulder, wing band, and rump. It has a white tail with a black band at the tip.
Length: 36-44cm
Australian magpies lay two to five oval-shaped eggs that are bluish-green in color.
Found In: Open forests, rural and urban areas

name: Australian masked owl
description:
The Australian masked owl has black-brown upperparts flecked with white, a buff barring on the wings and back, pale underparts, black spots on the breast and flanks, and a white facial disc with brown edges. The female is larger than the male.
Length: 33-46cm
Weight: 1.3kg
Found In: Forests, woodlands, caves.

name: Australian pelican
description:
The Australian pelican has a black rump, shoulders, and center of upper wing. All other feathers are white. They also have a pink bill.
Length: 160-180cm
Weight: 4-7.7kg
Interesting Fact: Australian pelicans will occasionally eat other birds such as silver gulls or grey teals or even small dogs.
Found In: Open fresh and salt water.

name: Australian sea lion
description:
The male Australian sea lion is a chocolate brown color with a golden-white crown and mane. The females are silvery grey above and are cream-colored below and on their face.
Length: male: 2-2.5m, female: 1.3-1.8m
Weight: male: 250-300kg, female: 61-104kg
Found In: Sheltered rocky bays for birthing and sandy beaches for loafing.

name: Azara's zorro
description:
The pampa gray fox is brindled gray with a paler underside.
Length: 62cm
Weight: 4.2-6.5kg
Found In: Pampas, hills, deserts.

name: Bald eagle
description:
The bald eagle has a black-brown back and breast, white head and tail, and a yellow bill and feet.
Length: 89-94cm
Weight: 4.5-6.3kg
Interesting Fact: Fifty percent of bald eagles live in Alaska because of the large salmon population found there.

name: Baleen whale
locations: Temperate ocean waters of both hemispheres
description:
The southern right whale has black skin with white patches on its chin and belly. The head and jaw are usually covered with large skin callosities of parasites (barnacles, worms, and whale lice).
Length: 5-18m
Weight: 50-56 metric tons
Interesting Fact: The name 'right whale' comes from the fact that hunters saw it as the right whale to hunt: it swims slowly, floats when killed for easy collection, and has a lot of oil and baleen.
Found In: Temperate oceans

name: Banded mongoose
description:
The banded mongoose has a brown-gray coat, brown to black feet, and dark brown bands on their back.
Length: 30-40cm
Weight: 1-2kg
Females give birth to four young after carrying them for two months.
Interesting Fact: Banded mongooses have been known to bunch together to drive off predators; they will even come to the aid of their companions in danger.
Found In: Grasslands

name: Black-collared barbet
description:
The black-collared barbet has a crimson face, throat and chest. The crown, hind neck, and upper breast are a glossy black color. Its upper parts are grayish-brown, and the lower breast to undertail coverts are yellowish-gray. Its underwing coverts are white.
 Length: 20cm
Interesting Fact: The beaks of barbets have obvious bristles which give them the appearance of having a beard, hence their name.
Found In: Thornvelds, open forests.

name: Barking gecko
description:
The barking gecko is reddish-brown with yellow spot. It has a thick, black tail that has white bands that come to a fine point at the end of it.
Length: 9.5cm
Interesting Fact: When feeling threatened or aggressive, barking geckos will raise their tails, open their mouths, and produce a barking sound.

name: Barrow goldeneye
description:
The male goldeneye has a puffy black head glossed with green. Its face has white spots, and the upper wing is white as well. Females are mottled brown and buff with a chocolate brown head.
Interesting Fact: A whistling sound can be heard as these birds fly, making them easily identifiable at long distances.
Found In: Forested lakes, rivers, salt bays, sea coasts

name: Bat-eared fox
description:
The bat-eared fox has large, wide ears, a short, narrow mouth, and long, jackal-like legs.
Length: 50-60cm
Height: 35-40cm
Weight: 3.4-5kg
Interesting Fact: The diet of the bat-eared fox is 80 percent insects, most of which are termites.
Found In: Woodlands, grassy plains.

name: Bateleur eagle
description:
The head, neck, breast, lower back of wings, and belly of the Bateleur eagle are black. The upper back of the wings is brown with white edges. Its back and tail are chestnut, with white underwings. Their eyes are surrounded by bright red facial skin.
Length: 53-68cm
Weight: 1.8-2.7kg
Interesting Fact: The word bateleur means balancer. This name comes from the fact that bateleur eagles steer in flight by changing the pitch of their wings up or down.
Found In: Grasslands, acacia savannas.

name: Bee-eater
description:
The bee-eater has a slim body and elongated central tail feathers. They are brightly colored and have long, decurved bills.
Bee-eaters lay around 2-8 eggs per clutch.
Interesting Fact: The bigger species travel in large flocks, sometimes of 300 birds.
Found In: Tropical regions.

name: Black-backed butcherbird
description:
The black-throated butcher bird has a bold black and white coloration. It has a white rump and collar, black bib, white bar on black wing, and white corner tips on a black tail.
Length: 32cm
The dominant female builds the nest, lays 1-4 eggs and incubates them.
Found In: Open woodlands, scrublands, rangelands.

name: Black and white colobus
description:
The black and white colobus monkey is glossy black with a white face and callosities. It also has a U-shaped white mantle and a whitish tail.
A single young is born to a female at a time.
Interesting Fact: Colobus monkeys have little or no thumbs.
Found In: Forests, woodlands, wooded grasslands.

name: Blackish oystercatcher
description:
The oystercatcher has dark to black plumage.
Length: 43cm
Two eggs are laid in November or December. If the first clutch is lost, a second clutch can be laid by January.
Found In: Rocky seacoasts, islets, beaches.

name: Black kite
description:
The black kite has dark brown feathers, pale wrists and shoulder stripes, and dark cheek patches.
Length:47-55 cm
Black kites migrate to their nesting areas February to May.
Interesting Fact: Black kites are often considered to be the world's most abundant, adaptable, and successful diurnal raptor.
Found In: Open woodlands close to water.

name: Black rhinoceros
description:
The black rhinoceros has two horns on its nose, a pointed and prehensile upper lip, and hairless gray skin.
Height: 1.4-1.7m
Weight: 800-1350kg
Females give birth to a single calf at intervals of 2.5-4 years.
Found In: Tropical bushlands, grasslands, savannas.

name: Black spider monkey
description:
The black spider monkey has a black coat, flesh-colored eye rings, white chin whiskers, and a long tail and legs.
Length: 40-53cm
Weight: 8.6kg
Interesting Fact: Spider monkeys are the most expert climbers of all monkeys.
Found In: High forests.

name: Black swan
description:
The black swan has sooty black feathers that are curled. The primaries and secondaries are white. Their eyes and bill are red in color.
Length: 106-142cm
Weight: 8kg
Found In: Slow-flowing, open waters.

name: Black vulture
description:
Black vultures are mostly black with a white patch near their wing tips. They have a bare gray head.
Length: 56-61cm
Weight: 1100-1900g
Interesting Fact: Vultures depend on their keen eyesight to find food.
Found In: Open country, flat lowlands.

name: Black-backed jackal
description:
The black-backed jackal has a russet coat with a brindled black and white saddle.
Length: 65-106cm
Height: 38-50cm
Weight: 7-15kg
After a gestation period of 63 days, females give birth to 1-9 pups.
Found In:Dry brush woodlands.

name: Brown capuchin
description:
The brown capuchin has coarse fur in various shades of brown. Its belly is pale in comparison, and it has black extremities. Its facial pattern is variable.
Length: 32-56cm
Weight: 2.5-3.9kg
Found In: Subtropical and tropical forests.

name: Black-capped chickadee
description:
As its name entails, the black-capped chickadee has a black cap and throat. It has white cheeks, a gray back, and dull white underparts.
Length: 12-15cm
Found In: Mixed and deciduous forests.

name: Black-cheeked waxbill
description:
The male black-cheeked waxbill has a gray head, back, breast, and throat. They have a black barring and a faint pink coloration. The belly, flanks, and rump are a dull scarlet. Its cheeks, throat, tail, flight feathers, and legs are black. The male also has red eyes and a blue-black bill. The female, like most species, has duller colors and paler flanks. The eyes are brown in color.
Found In: Low and dry thorn scrub.

name: Black-crowned crane
description:
The black-crowned crane has long legs and neck, a straight bill, a bare pink or red cheek patch, and a golden feathery crown on its head.
Height: 110-130cm
Weight: 3-4kg
Found In: Open marshlands, grasslands, swamps, wet plains or prairies.

name: Black-crowned night heron
description:
As its name implies, the black-crowned night heron has a black crown and mantle. It also has gray wings and white underparts.
Length: 58-65cm
Found In: Lakes, marshes, rivers.

name: Black-eyed bulbul
description:
Overall, the black-eyed bulbul is mouse brown. Its head, face, and chin are black. Their underparts can vary from light brown to white. Their eyes are surrounded by a black wattle.
Length: 20cm
Weight: 39g
Interesting Fact: The black-eyed bulbul is probably the most common bird in Africa.
Found In: Rural and urban areas, wooded areas.

name: Black-footed ferret
description:
The black-footed ferret has a yellowish coat. Its facial mask, tail tip, and feet are dark.
Length: 38-45cm
Weight: 900-1000g
Interesting Fact: This species is extinct in the wild due to the decrease of prairie dog populations, their main food source, by poisoning, hunting, etc.
Found In: Prairies.

name: Black-necked stork
description:
The black-necked stork has a white body with a black head, neck, tail, and bands across its wing coverts. It has a black bill and red legs.
Length: 129-150cm
Interesting Fact: Black-necked storks are known to use the same nest repeatedly in successive breeding attempts.
Found In: Inland wetlands.

name: Black-tailed prairie dog
description:
The tip of the black-tailed prairie dog's tail is black, hence the name. The rest of the body is buff to brown in color.
Length: 28-32cm
Weight: 1-2kg
Prairie dogs live in 'towns' containing up to several thousand animals.
Found In: Grasslands.

name: Black-winged stilt
description:
The black-winged stilt is white with all black wings. It has a black cap to the rear of its head, long pink legs, and a long black bill.
Length: 38cm
Found In: Freshwater swamps, marshes, lagoons.

name: Blackbuck
description:
The dominant male blackbuck has large horns, black sides and back, and white undersides. The female and subordinate male are yellowish-fawn in color.
Length: 1.2m
Height: 60-83cm
Weight: 25-45kg
Found In: Open grasslands.

name: Blackish oystercatcher
description:
The oystercatcher has dark to black plumage.
Length: 43cm
Found In: Rocky seacoasts, islets, beaches.

name: Blacksmith plover
description:
The blacksmith plover has a white forehead, crown, back of neck, and upper tail coverts. Its upper wing coverts and scapulars are gray. The upper parts, including the chest and breast, are black. They have a black band at the tip of their tail, and a black spur on its wings. All other areas on this animal are white.
Length: 30cm
A monogamous breeding pair works together to build their nest on the ground. The female will then lay 1-4 eggs. She and her mate will incubate the eggs for 23-31 days.
Found In: Short grasslands near water.

name: Blesbok
description:
The blesbok is a rich purple-chestnut color with a darker neck and hindquarters. The rump, belly, lower legs, and face patch are white.
Length: 1.4-1.6m
Height: 84-99cm
Weight: 59-100kg
Interesting Fact: The blesbok was almost fully extinct until it became a protected species in Africa.
Found In: Open grasslands.

name: Blue waxbill
description:
The blue waxbill has a brown back and crown, distinctive blue rump, face, breast and tail.
Length: 13cm
Weight: 10g
Found In: Woodlands, grasslands.

name: Blue and gold macaw
description:
The blue and gold macaw, a very colorful bird, has a green forehead and front of crown. Its underwings are olive-yellow. The upper parts are blue and the throat is black. Three lines of black feathers cross its white facial skin. The sides of the macaw's neck is orange with a green border at throat. Its underparts are yellow, and the tail is blue.
Length: 86cm
Found In: Riverside forests to open savannas.

name: Blue crane
description:
The top of head, nape, lores, and chin of the blue crane are a pale blue-gray color. The neck is slate, and the body plumage is slate-gray. The blue crane's flight feathers are black, and long tertials reach the ground.
Length: 107cm
Interesting Fact: Blue cranes will often sleep while standing in the water.
Found In: Grasslands.

name: Blue racer
description:
The body of the blue racer is long and slender. It is either metallic green, blue, or gray in color.
Length: 2m
Found In: Dense woodlands, rocky outcrops.

name: Blue shark
description:
The blue shark has long, slender pectoral fins, a pointed snout, and is bright blue in color.
Length: 2.7-3.8m
Weight: 30-52kg
Found In: Open seas, surface waters.

name: Blue wildebeest
description:
The wildebeest is a thick-necked, long-faced antelope with horns that flare out sideways and then upwards (rather like a cow???s). Its body color ranges from dark gray brown to slate blue to pale grayish fawn, with various degrees of mottling. The muzzle, tail and shaggy mane are all black. The neck and chin are bearded in long black, brown, cream, or white hair. Their short legs are brown or ochre. It has downward curving horns with ends that point up and inward.
Length: 1.7-2.4m
Height: 1.3-1.4m
Weight: male: 230kg, female: 160kg
Found In: Open grasslands, bush savannas.

name: Blue-faced booby
description:
The blue-faced booby is mostly white with black or dark brown flight feathers and tail. Its bill and feet are yellow. The booby's facial skin is gray-black around the bill.
Length: 74-86cm
Found In: Tropical seas.

name: Blue-footed booby
description:
The blue-footed booby has a pale, streaked head, a dark mantle with white patches on the nape and rump, white undersides, a dark tail, and bright blue legs and feet.
Length: 66cm
One to three eggs are laid on the bare ground. Both parents alternate incubating the eggs for 46 days.
Found In: Open seas, coasts, islands.

name: Blue tongue lizard
description:
The blue-tongued lizard is pale silver-gray to brown in color. It either has darker brown cross bands with small white spots or pale cross bands with no spots.
Length: 30cm
Blue-tongued lizards give birth only once a year. They carry shell-less membrane-bound eggs in their bodies that hatch as they are laid.
Interesting Fact: Due to its tame nature, this species is often kept as a pet.
Found In: Forests, woodlands, grasslands, semiarid areas.

name: Boat-billed heron
description:
The boat-billed heron has a white forehead, throat, and breast. It has large eyes, a chestnut belly, and a broad bill. It is silver-gray in color with a black crown.
Length: 60cm
Weight: 600g
Found In: Swamps, forests near freshwater lagoons.

name: Bobcat
description:
The bobcat has a short tail, small ear tufts, and a barred and spotted coat with black or variable shades of brown fur. Its undersides are white, and the tip of the tail is black.
Length: 65-100cm
Weight: 6-31kg
Found In: Chaparral, brush, swamps, forests.

name: Bohor reedbuck
description:
The Bohor reedbuck is light buff with black marked forelegs. Its horns are hooked to the front and are found on males only.
Length: 100-130cm
Height: 69-89cm
Weight: 45kg
Found In: Savannas, lowlands.

name: Bonnet macaque
description:
The bonnet macaque is gray-brown in color with pale undersides and a pale pink face.
Length: 35-60cm
Weight: 3.7-6.3kg
Found In: Forests, urban and rural areas.

name: Bottlenose dolphin
description:
The bottle-nosed dolphin has a dark gray back and lighter flanks. Its belly is either white or pink.
Length: 3-4.2m
Weight: 150-200kg
Interesting Fact: The intelligent bottle-nose dolphin is often seen in zoos, aquariums, and in TV shows.
Found In: Temperate and tropical coastal waters.

name: Brazilian tapir
description:
The tapir has a short, fleshy trunk formed from the nose and upper lip. The body is short and stout.
Length: 180-250cm
Height: 75-120cm
Weight: 225-300kg
Interesting Fact: Tapirs are related to horses and rhinoceroses. They are excellent swimmers and rock climbers.
Found In: Forests.

name: Brolga crane
description:
The brolga crane has a naked gray head with scarlet skin on the rear of the head and nape. It has a black dewlap under chin. The crane's neck and back are silver-gray and often have brownish tints. It has gray wings, black primaries, and gray underparts.
Length: 107-114cm
Height: 140cm
Weight: 5.7-6.8kg
Interesting Fact: Brolga cranes are the only crane species to have a salt gland (located at the corner of the eyes) through which they rid their bodies of excess salt.
Found In: Wetlands, farmlands, open plains.

name: Brown-and-yellow marshbird
description:
The brown and yellow marshbird has brown above, yellow patches at the bend in the wing, and a dark brown throat and chest.
Length: 23.5cm
Interesting Fact: Once the young hatch, up to eight 'helper' brown and yellow marshbirds will arrive at the nest and feed the young.
Found In: Marshes, moist grasslands, farmland.

name: Brown hyena
description:
The most distinguishable feature of a hyena is that its back slopes to the rear. Its coat is dark brown to brown-black in color. Hyenas have a long, lighter-colored mane on their neck and shoulders.
Length: 1.1-1.2m
Interesting Fact: Hyenas are master scavengers and are able to completely digest bone matter. Other indigestible items such as hooves, horns, and hair are regurgitated in pellets.
Found In: Dry savannas, plains, semi deserts.

name: Brown lemur
description:
The upper parts and tail of the brown lemur are gray-brown. They have white cheeks and beard, black muzzle and forehead. underparts are cream-colored.
Length: 43-50cm
Weight: 2.1-4.2kg
Found In: Forests.

name: Brown pelican
description:
The brown pelican has a dark brown body, a long flat bill, and a whitish head with a dark brown hind-neck during breeding season.
Length: 127cm
Interesting Fact: The brown pelican is the smallest pelican species and the only one that is not white. They have a wingspan of 6.5 feet.
Found In: Coasts, oceans.

name: Brush-tailed phascogale
description:
The brush-tailed possum has grizzled gray upperparts with cream or white undersides. It has a black 'bottle brush' tail with long hairs.
Length: 14.8-26cm
Weight: 106-311g
Interesting Fact: Home ranges may include as many as 20 separate nests.
Found In: Open forests.

name: Burrowing owl
description:
The face of the burrowing owl is framed with white. They have a black collar, a short tail, and long legs.
Length: 23-28cm
Interesting Fact: Burrowing owls often make their homes in abandoned prairie dog holes.
Found In: Semi-deserts, treeless grasslands, open prairies.

name: Bush dog
description:
The bush dog is dark brown with a lighter head and nape. Its chin and undersides are either cream or dark. It has short legs, a compact body, a short snout, and small ears.
Length: 57.5-75cm
Height: 26cm
Weight: 5-7kg
Found In: Forests, savannas.

name: Bushbuck
description:
The bushbuck has a short coat in varying shades of brown, white transverse and vertical body stripes, a black band from the eyes to the muzzle, a white spot on its cheek, and two white throat patches.
Length: 110-145cm
Weight: 24-75kg
Found In: Regions with dense cover.

name: Bushpig
description:
The bushpig has red to gray bristles and a white face and mane. The males have facial warts.
Length: 100-150cm
Height: 76cm
Weight: 50-120kg
Found In: Forests, moist savanna woodlands, grasslands.

name: Buttermilk snake
description:
The buttermilk snake has black to green colorations with pale flecks. It also has smooth dorsal scales.
Length: up to 2m
Females can lay up to 45 eggs per clutch.
Interesting Fact: Despite its common name, the racer's actual speed is about 6.5 kilometers per hour (4 mph), or about the rate of a human's brisk walk.
Found In: Dry lowlands, mountains.

name: Canada goose
description:
The Canada goose has a brownish body with a black head. It has a long black neck and a white cheek patch.
Length: 56-110cm
Weight: 1-9kg
Canada geese return to their birthplace to breed every season.
Interesting Fact: There are 12 geographically distinct races of Canada geese.
Found In: Lakes, ponds, bays, marshes, fields.

name: Canadian tiger swallowtail butterfly
description:
The Canadian tiger swallowtail butterfly has yellow wings with wide black tiger stripes. It also has a wide black band along the inner margin of its hindwing. The butterfly has a yellow underwing with orange and black scaling.
Found In: Open woodlands.

name: Cape Barren geese
description:
Cape Barren geese are pale gray with a short black triangular bill, a lime green cere, and dark spots on their wings, scapulars, and wing coverts. They have pink or red legs, black feet, black wingtips, and black tail and under wing coverts.
Length: 75-100cm
Interesting Fact: The female can loose up to 1/5 of her body weight while incubating her eggs.
Found In: Grasslands, mud flats, marshes, offshore islands.

name: Cape cobra
description:
The Cape cobra is black or brown in color and is mottled with yellow or orange.
Length: 1-2m
Interesting Fact: This species has the most potent venom of any African snake. The venom is a neurotoxin, causing victims to die from suffocation.
Found In: Arid savannas, urban and rural areas.

name: Cape fox
description:
The coat of the cape fox is rufous-agouti with a silver-gray back, a black tail tip, and a dark facial mask.
Length: 45-61cm
Weight: 3.6-4.5kg
Found In: Steppes, rocky deserts.

name: Cape raven
description:
The white-necked raven has black facial feathers with a faint purple gloss on its head. There is also a white patch on the hind neck. The body feathers are deep black in color, and the bill is black with a yellow or white tip.
Length: 52cm
Height: 45cm
Found In: Open mountainous country, urban areas.

name: Cape white-eye
description:
The upper parts and sides of face of the Cape white-eye are olive green. It has a black lores, a white eye ring, and a yellow chin, throat and underside. Its chest and belly may be gray, yellow, or white.
Length: 11cm
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Capybara
description:
The capybara has light brown coloration, long bristle-like hairs, no tail, and partial webbing between its toes.
Length: 1-1.3m
Height: 50-62cm
Weight: 35-66kg
Interesting Fact: Capybaras, the largest living rodents, are excellent swimmers and divers.
Found In: Forests, open grasslands.

name: Caribou
description:
The caribou is brown in the summer and gray in the winter. It has a white rump and tail, and no naked patch on the muzzle. Both sexes have antlers.
Length: 1.2-2.2m
Height: 107-127cm
Weight: 91-272kg
Interesting Fact: Caribou are the only deer species in which both males and females have antlers and do not have a naked muzzle patch.
Found In: Tundra, woodlands.

name: Carmine bee-eater
description:
The carmine bee-eater has a dark blue-green forehead and crown, a black line through the eyes, and carmine plumage with a brownish tinge. The wings of the bee-eater are darker, and the tail feathers are elongated. The underparts (rump and undertail coverts) are bright carmine.
Length: 36cm
Carmine bee-eaters are a summer migrant. They will often follow other animals to catch any insects they may disturb.
Found In: Near rivers, marshes, open country.

name: Carpet python
description:
The carpet python has black to gray patterns of blotches, and it has bands and stripes on a yellowish to dark brown background.
Length: 2-3.6m
Found in: Coastal rain forests to central deserts.

name: Cattle egret
description:
The cattle egret is mostly white with a buff-colored crown, breast, and crest during its breeding season. Its legs are either yellow or orange in color.
Length: 50cm
Interesting Fact: This species has been particularly successful in expanding its home ranges. It was virtually unknown in North America before 1952 and now inhabits most of the continent.
Found In: Open land, farms, marshes.

name: Chacma baboon
description:
The chacma baboon has gray-agouti, longer hair over its shoulders, and a bare patch of black skin over its hips. The chacma baboon's exact coat color varies by location. Its face is naked and black.
Length: 1m
Weight: 12-25kg
Found In: Savannas, rocky areas, woodlands.

name: Chameleon
description:
Chameleons often have head appendages, dorsal crests, a prehensile tail, and toes fused into grasping claws.
Length: 10-70cm
Found In: Rain forests to savannas, mountains.

name: Cheetah
description:
The cheetah has a tawny coat with small black spots. Black tear lines run from the inner corner of its eyes to the corner of its mouth.
Length: 112-135cm
Weight: 39-65kg
Interesting Fact: Running at 69.5 miles per hour, cheetahs are the fastest land animal.
Found In: Open country, deserts, savannas.

name: Chestnut weaver
description:
The breeding male chestnut weaver has a black head, and a chestnut-colored rump and upper tail coverts. The weaver's tail and flight feathers are black with white edges. The rest of the plumage is chestnut. The female, however, has a green head streaked with black. Her back is also streaked. There is a stripe above the eye, and her chest and underparts are white.
Length: 16 cm.

name: Chilean flamingo
description:
The Chilean flamingo is pale pink with bright vermilion wings. The primaries and secondaries are black. The Chilean flamingo also has a black downward-curved bill with a yellow base and blue legs with red tarsal joints.
Length: 110cm
Found In: Lakes, muddy seacoasts.

name: Chimpanzee
description:
The chimpanzee has blackish hair and a lighter face. The face, however, darkens with age.
Length: 68-94cm
Height: 120-170cm
Weight: 50-70kg
Interesting Fact: Chimpanzees are often seen using twigs and stems as tools to get termites and ants out of their nests.
Found In: Rain forests, savannas with woodlands.

name: Chital
description:
The chital is rufous-fawn with white spots on its back.
Length: 100-175cm
Height: 91cm
Weight: 86kg
Interesting Fact: Chitals readily take to water and are said to be good swimmers.
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Chuckwalla
description:
The chuckwalla has dark skin and a pale yellow tail. The male is speckled with yellow and red, and the female has dark cross bands.
Length: 28-42cm
Found In: Rocky deserts.

name: Civet
description:
The civet has large pointed ears, partial webbing between the toes, and a spotted or striped coat.
Interesting Fact: There are 34 species of civet.

name: Common palm civet
description:
The common palm civet has a buff to dark brown coat with black stripes down the back and spots on the sides. It also has a facemask of black spots and retractile claws.
Length: 54cm
Weight: 3.4kg
Interesting Fact: Common palm civets are also known as the toddy cat because they eat fermented palm sap called toddy.
Found In: Forests, tropical rainforests.

name: Clark's nutcracker
description:
Clark's nutcracker is pale gray with white around its bill base and undertail coverts. The wings are black with a white patch on the secondaries. The tail of the nutcracker is black with white outer feathers.
Length: 28cm
Interesting Fact: A single bird may store more than 30,000 seeds in one season.
Found In: High mountains, woodlands.

name: Collared lizard
description:
The collared lizard has a ring of light and dark markings.
Length: 20-35.5cm
Interesting Fact: These lizards are unlike most in that they cannot regenerate their tails.
Found In: Rocky hillsides, forests.

name: Collared peccary
description:
The collared peccary is grizzled gray with a darker back and limbs. It also has a pale band running diagonally from the midback to the chest.
Length: 75-90cm
Height: 30-40cm
Weight: 17-25kg
Interesting Fact: If a group is attacked, one peccary will stay behind to fight the predator, allowing the others to escape.
Found In: Semi deserts, arid woodlands, forests.

name: Columbian rainbow boa
description:
The Columbian rainbow boa is uniformly brown with a faint ring/spot pattern.
Interesting Fact: This species is particularly popular as a pet.

name: Common dolphin
description:
The back of the common dolphin is black or brown, and the chest and belly are cream to white in color. This dolphin also has a unique hourglass pattern that is tan and pales to gray on its flanks. It has black stripes from the flipper to the lower jaw and from the eye to the base of its beak.
Length: 2.1-2.6m
Weight: 75kg
Found In: Temperate and tropical oceans.

name: Common duiker
description:
The duiker is sandy tan in color and has a crest of hairs on its forehead. The males have sharp horns.
Length: 80-115cm
Found In: Scrub country to open grasslands.

name: Common eland
description:
The common eland has a light tan coat color, a few light stripes across its forequarters, black and white leg markings, and a black stripe along its back. Males have heavier horns than females as well as a mat of hair on the forehead.
 Length: 2.1-3.5m
Height: 1.3-1.8m
Weight: 900kg
Interesting Fact: Elands are the largest type of antelope.
Found In: Open plains, savannas, mopane bush, montane forests, semi deserts.

name: Common green iguana
description:
The common green iguana is pale green in color and has a crest from the back of the neck to the middle of its tail. The iguana also has an erectable throat sac and black stripes running across its back.
Length: up to 182cm
Found In: Tropical forests.

name: Common grenadier
description:
The common grenadier is a colorful species with a chestnut brown body, olive brown wings, a blue rump, a black tail, violet cheeks, a blue forehead, a black throat, and a red eye ring and bill. The colors are lighter in the female.
Found In: Dry thornveld, woodlands.

name: Common langur
description:
The common langur has either gray or gray-brown fur tinged with yellow. It has a whitish crown, underparts, and tail tip. Some populations have a crest on the crown.
Length: 41-78cm
Weight: 5.4-23.6kg
Found In: Forests, scrub, farmlands, urban areas.

name: Common melba finch
description:
The forehead, cheeks, chin, and center of the throat of the male common melba finch are scarlet. Its upperparts are gray, and its back and wings are olive green. The tail is black and crimson, and the breast is a golden green color. Its underparts are barred with white and black. The female melba finch has a gray head, and the area from the chest to the belly is barred with black and white.
Length: 13cm
Found In: Dry thornveld.

name: Common mynah
description:
The head of the common mynah is brown with glossy black. It has a white wing patch and under tail, and a yellow patch around the eyes and bill.
Length: 25cm
Found In: Open country, rural and urban areas.

name: Common nighthawk
description:
The common nighthawk is generally blackish in color. It has long, pointed wings, a short tail with a shallow fork, a white band from halfway down the wing to the far tip, and black primaries. The throat patch of the nighthawk is triangular and white or buff in color. The male's tail tip has a white band.
Length: 23-25cm
Found In: Open woodlands, clearings, open scrub, mountains, rural and urban areas.

name: Common raccoon
description:
The common raccoon is grizzled gray and has a tail striped with brown and black rings. Its black facial mask makes this animal easily recognizable.
Length: 55cm
Weight: 5-8kg
Found In: Wooded areas, swamps, urban areas.

name: Common shelduck
description:
The shelduck is predominantly white with a glossy green-black head and neck, a chestnut breast band, and a bright red bill.
Length: 64cm
Found In: Coastal estuaries.

name: Common wolf
description:
The common wolf has short dark fur.
Length: 1-1.4m
Height: 66-81cm
Weight: 12-80kg
Only the dominant pair of the pack is allowed to breed. They form a lifelong pair bond. Mating takes place in late winter.
Interesting Fact: As a subspecies of the gray wolf, the common wolf is an ancestor of domestic dogs.
Found In: Forests.

name: Common wombat
description:
The wombat has coarse, brown or gray fur and a bare muzzle.
Length: 90-115cm
Height: 36cm
Weight: 22-39kg
Found In: Temperate forests, heaths, mountains.

name: Coqui francolin
description:
The male coqui francolin is streaked and barred with black, chestnut, and gray-brown. He has a rufous-yellow head and neck, and the lower neck and chest are white with black bars. Its underparts are buff with black bars. The female has a white throat with a black border, and a thin black line above the eye and down the neck. She is brownish-wine in color.
Length: 28cm
Found In: Wooded grasslands.

name: Coyote
description:
The coyote is buff-gray with brownish yellow parts. It has a white throat and belly, a black stripe down its back, and black patches on the forelegs and end of tail.
Length: 70-97cm
Height: 45-53cm
Weight: 11.5-15kg
Interesting Fact: Coyotes can interbreed with domestic dogs.
Found In: Prairies, open woodlands.

name: Crab-eating raccoon
description:
The crab-eating raccoon is yellowish-red to brown to grayish-brown. It has paler undersides, a black mask, and tail rings.
Length: 55-76cm
Weight: 3-7kg
Interesting Fact: Crab-eating raccoons are excellent climbers.
Found In: Marshes, jungles.

name: Crested barbet
description:
This is a monogamous bird species. One to five eggs are laid in a tree hole sometime between September and December. Incubation lasts 13-17 days, after which both parents help care for the hatchlings. The chicks fledge by 31 days of age. A pair of barbets can have up to five broods in a season.
Length: 24cm
Weight: 72g
Found In: Tree savannas, woodlands, riverines.

name: Crested bunting
description:
The crested bunting, like the name suggest, has a feather crest on the back its head. Its wings and tail are chestnut brown. The male: blue-black head and body; female: streaked upper parts and breast.
Length: 17cm
Found In: Dry rocky and grassy hillsides, areas of forest cultivation.

name: Crested screamer
description:
The crested screamer is slate or grayish-brown in color. It has a narrow white neck ring with a broader black ring underneath. Red bare skin surrounds the eyes.
Length: 91cm
Found In: Tropical/subtropical lakes, lagoons, marshes, flooded fields, meadows, llanos.

name: Crimson-breasted shrike
description:
Length:23 cm.
Interesting Fact: Their habit of impaling their prey into thorns has earned them the name 'butcherbird.
Found In: Open forests.

name: Crowned eagle
description:
The crowned eagle has a long rounded crest, black upper parts, and its flight feathers are ash-colored and tipped with black. The tail is long and barred, and the eagle's undersides are white and mottled with brown and black feathers.
Length: 90cm.
Interesting Fact: This species is the largest eagle in Africa. They are also very agile fliers, easily navigating among trees in the forest.
Found In: Forests, open country, rocky hills.

name: Cuis
description:
Microcavia australis has a body that is short and robust with a head that makes up about 1/3 of the head-body length. Head-body length averages 22 cm, and no tail is present. Adults weigh about 300 g. Microcavia australis is a ground-dwelling hystricomorph rodent. Its coat is a course, dark agouti, from brown to a grayish-color. There is a prominent white ring around the eye. The species is known to have fairly large eyes and big ears, which are close to the head. The forefeet are strong and flat, usually with four digits, each ending with a sharp claw. The hind feet have three elongated digits with claws.
Length: 22cm
Weight: 250-300g
Found In: Semiarid thornbush habitats and deserts.

name: Curassow
description:
The currasow has either black or brown unpatterned plumage, and the sexes are dissimilar.
Length: 75-112cm
Found In: Neotropics.

name: Curve-billed thrasher
description:
The bill of the curve-billed thrasher is pale gray-brown and curves downward. Its tail is long.
Length: 24-29cm
Found In: Desert, urban areas.

name: Dama wallaby
description:
Length: males: 590-680cm; females: 520-630cm
Weight: males: 6-10kg; females: 4-6kg
Found In: Coastal scrub, woodlands, thickets.

name: Darwin ground finch
description:
The breeding Darwin ground finch has a black bill, while the nonbreeding finch has a yellow bill. The male is black, and the female is streaked brown.
Interesting Fact: Ground finches were made famous by Darwin's theory of evolution of beak size.

name: Defassa waterbuck
description:
The coloration of the waterbuck varies from yellowish-brown to grayish-black. Some individuals have a white ring around their rump or a white rump patch. Their ears are tipped with black, and males have large, ringed horns.
Length: 1.8-2.2m
Height: 1.2-1.4m
Weight: 159-227kg
A single calf is born after a gestation period of nine months.
Found In: Savannas, woodlands, stony hills, near water.

name: Desert kangaroo rat
description:
The desert kangaroo rat has white stripes and a white tuft at the end of its long tail. Its body is mostly a dusty brown color.
Length: 10-20cm
Interesting Fact: The desert kangaroo rat has kidneys that are four times more efficient than a human's kidneys. Because of this, desert kangaroo rats never have to drink water - it all comes from their food.
Found In: Arid brushlands and grasslands.

name: Desert spiny lizard
description:
The desert spiny lizard has large scales and a dark shoulder spot. Males have an iridescent blue-violet center on their back and a green-blue color on their sides and tail.
Length: 22-35cm
Found In: Deserts, semi deserts.

name: Desert tortoise
description:
Length:up to 38 cm.
Interesting Fact: Ravens, coyotes, foxes, eagles, and roadrunners are all predators of the desert tortoise.
Found In: Scrublands, deserts, rocky hillsides.

name: Dingo
description:
The dingo is reddish-brown with irregular white patches.
Length: 150cm
Height: 50cm
Weight: 20kg
Found In: Tropical forests to semiarid regions.

name: Downy woodpecker
description:
The downy woodpecker has black and white plumage, a broad white stripe down the back (shoulders to the rump), and wings checkered with black and white feathers. The downy woodpecker has white undersides, a black crown, and black and white lines on the neck. Males have a red patch behind their crown.
Length: 15-18cm
Weight: 22-33g
Downy woodpeckers form life-long breeding pairs. They may return to the same nesting area each year.
Found In: Mixed and deciduous forests, urban areas.

name: Dusky rattlesnake
description: N/A

name: Eagle owl
locations: worldwide except Australia ans pacific islands
description:
The eagle owl is buff to yellow-orange in color. It has streaks of dark brown and/or white throughout, ear tufts of varying size, and a white throat patch.
Eagle owls will often steal nests from other large birds or will nest in debris platforms in trees or on cliffs.
Found In: Temperate and tropical forests, open country, semi deserts.

name: Eastern boa constrictor
description:
The Eastern boa constrictor is pale reddish-brown mixed with gray with black and brown patterns on its back. Black markings with reddish blotches (often with white) are on its sides.
Length: 2.4m
Found In: Open woodlands.

name: Eastern box turtle
locations: Eastern parts of Central North America
description:
The patterns of the Eastern box turtle can vary in color. The carapace is domed.
Length: 10-20cm
Interesting Fact: Eastern box turtles are able to eat poisonous mushrooms without getting sick. However, any animal that eats a turtle after it has fed on the mushrooms will be poisoned.
Found In: Moist forests.

name: Eastern cottontail rabbit
description:
The Eastern cottontail rabbit has deep buff upper parts, and its fur is heavily lined with black making it appear rusty brown. The rabbit's undersides are white.
Length: 38-46cm
Found In: Brushlands, pastures, field edges.

name: Eastern diamondback rattlesnake
description:
The Eastern diamondback rattlesnake has a diamond pattern along its back, making this animal easy to identify.
Length: 91-240cm
Weight: 10kg
Interesting Fact: This is the largest rattler species and the most dangerous snake in North America. Its venom attacks the victim's blood cells.
Found In: Woodlands, farmlands.

name: Eastern fox squirrel
description:
This large tree squirrel is considerably bigger and heavier than the gray squirrel. There are three-color phases of the eastern fox squirrel: black, gray, and red. The top of the head in all color phases is almost invariably black, while the nose and ears are usually a creamy white. The fur is coarse, the feet large with naked soles, and the tail is flattened and well furred.
Length: 45-70cm
Weight: 504-1062g
Interesting Fact: The eastern fox squirrel is the largest tree squirrel.
Found In: Hardwood forests on uplands, urban areas, along shrubby fencerows.

name: Eastern grey kangaroo
description:
The Eastern grey kangaroo is a steel gray color with paler undersides.
Length: 96-230cm
Weight: 3.5-66kg
Interesting Fact: The eastern gray kangaroo can leap more than nine meters in a single bound.
Found In: Grasslands, open woodlands.

name: Eastern indigo snake
description:
Adult eastern indigo snakes are blue-black or brown in color, and the juveniles have washed-out crossbars.
Length: up to 2.3m
Interesting Fact: This is the largest nonpoisonous snake found in North America.
Found In: Scrub and pine flatwoods.

name: Eastern white pelican
description:
The eastern white pelican has a white body and white upperwing feathers. The underwing feathers are black and white. The eastern white pelican has a large, broad bill with a yellow gular pouch, and its wings have a pinkish tinge during breeding season.
Length: 140-175cm
Found In: Large lakes and lagoons, coastal waters, slow moving rivers.

name: Egyptian viper
description:
The Egyptian viper has a yellowish, dark brown, and black uniform top with brown cross bands.
Length: 1.5-2.5m
Interesting Fact: Egyptian vipers are extremely dangerous snakes. Their venom is a neurotoxin, causing paralysis and death (due to respiratory failure) in their victims.
Found In: Farmlands, open fields, arid country sides.

name: Egyptian goose
description:
The Egyptian goose is a buff color with darker upper parts, white forewings, long pink legs, a pale head with a dark brown collar, and brown patches on the face and belly.
Length: 63-73cm
Interesting Fact: This is the most widespread waterfowl species in Africa.
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Egyptian vulture
description:
The Egyptian vulture has white plumage with black primaries. It has a yellow bill with a black tip and yellow feet.
Length: 60-70cm
Interesting Fact: These birds break open eggs by dropping rocks on them.
Found In: Open country.

name: Elegant crested tinamou
description:
Height: 300cm.
found In: Habitat:Forests, grasslands.

name: Elk
description:
Elk have branched antlers, a light bay summer coat, and a darker coat with gray underparts in the winter. The males have a longer mane around their neck during the rut.
Length: 1.5-2.5m
Height: 130-152cm
Weight: 240-454kg
Found In: Open deciduous forests, mountains, plains, moorland.

name: Emerald green tree boa
description:
The emerald green tree boa is bright green with white bands across the body and a yellow underside.
Length: 1.2m
Interesting Fact: The fastest of all boas, the emerald green tree boa is also a very good swimmer. It uses heat sensors, called labial pits, on its upper lip to locate prey.
Found In: Rain forests.

name: Emerald-spotted dove
description:
The emerald-spotted wood dove has brown upper parts and a gray forehead. It also has two broad black bands across its rump, brownish-pink below, light chestnut under the wings and flanks, and emerald green metallic spots on the inner secondaries.
Length: 20cm
Found In: Woodlands, dry thornveld savannas.

name: Emu
description:
The emu has grayish-brown feathers and short gray feathers on its neck.
Height: 2m
Weight: 50kg
Interesting Fact: Second in size only to the ostrich, emus are Australia's largest birds.
Found In: Arid plains, woodlands, deserts.

name: Eurasian badger
description:
The Eurasian badger has grayish-black upper parts, black undersides including legs and feet, and a white head and ear tips. The badger also has a black facial stripe.
Length: 56-81cm
Weight: 12kg
Found In: Forests, grasslands.

name: Eurasian beaver
description:
Although normally reddish-brown, the coat color of the European beaver can range from yellowish-brown to black. Its tail is flat and scaly and the hind feet are webbed.
Length: 73-130cm
Height: 30-60cm
Weight: 11-30kg
Interesting Fact: The European beaver is the largest rodent found in Europe.
Found In: Wooded banks of rivers and lakes.

name: Eurasian hoopoe
description:
The Eurasian hoopoe has a black-tipped crest, a long slender bill that is decurved, a wide white band across its tail, and a black and white pattern on its wings.
Length: 26-30cm
Found In: Savannas, broken woodlands.

name: Euro wallaby
description:
The Euro wallaby has dark gray to reddish coloration on top and paler undersides. Males are typically larger than females.
Length: 110-200cm
Weight: 6.25-46.5kg
Found In: Rocky hills, rocky ledges, stony rises.

name: Fairy penguin
description:
The head and body of the fairy penguin are a striking indigo blue color. Its chin, throat, undersides, and tail are white. This type of penguin has no crest.
Length: 38-43cm
Weight: 650-900g
Found In: Temperate seas, inshore waters, rocky or sandy areas.

name: Fat-tailed dunnart
description:
The fat-tailed dunnart has dusty brown fur, large ears, and a short, swollen tail.
Length: 60-90mm
Weight: 10-20g
Found In: Woodlands, shrublands, plains and fields.

name: Feathertail glider
description:
Some distinguishing characteristics of the feathertail glider include a light blue-gray color, short fur on the top and bottom of the tail, longer hairs on the sides of the tail, and a gliding membrane that stretches from the elbows to the knees.
Length: 65-80mm
Weight: 10-14g
Found In: Forests, woodlands.

name: Ferruginous hawk
locations: Western parts of Central North America
description:
The ferruginous hawk is rufous above and whitish below. It has rufous wrist patches and leg feathers, black primary tips, and feathered legs and feet.
Length: 57-64cm
Found In: Plains, prairies.

name: Field flicker
description:
The field flicker has a golden patch on the upper breast extending to the face and neck. It is barred white, buff, and dark brown above, and it is pale with dark bars below. It has a white rump, and the male has a black and red moustache.
Length: 28-31cm
Found In: Grasslands, farmlands, lowlands.

name: Fisher
description:
The coat of the fisher can vary from medium to dark brown with gold to silver hoariness on the head and shoulders. The fisher has a black tail and legs and tail and a cream patch on the chest.
 Length: 47-75cm
Weight: 2-5kg
Interesting Fact: Fishers are highly valued for their fur.
Found In: Forests.

name: Flightless cormorant
description:
The flightless cormorant has stunted wings.
Length: 91cm
Interesting Fact: This is the only species of cormorant that is found in the Galapagos Islands and that cannot fly.

name: Flying fox
description:
The flying fox has dense fur that can vary in color. It is usually, however, mostly brown. Its face is like that of a fox.
Length: 5-40cm
Weight: .02-1.5kg
Found In: Tropical and subtropical regions.

name: Fork-tailed drongo
description:
The fork-tailed drongo is a glossy blue-black color and has a fish-like forked tail and brick red eyes.
Length: 25cm
Interesting Fact: Mobs of fork-tailed drongos will attack larger predators to drive them away.
Found In: Open bush country.

name: Four-striped grass mouse
description: The four-striped grass mouse has a band of seven alternating stripes (four black and three white) along its back.

name: Frilled dragon
description:
The frilled dragon's body color ranges from brown or gray to red-brown. It has a long neck frill that varies from light brown to orange or yellow.
Length: 45-90cm
Interesting Fact: The frill can be up to 20 cm across.
Found In: Sub humid to semiarid grassy woodlands, dry sclerophyll forests.

name: Fringe-eared oryx
description:
With the fringe-eared oryx, females are smaller than males. They are fawn in color and have black markings on the face. Dark lines run down the sides of the belly, and the nose and undersides are white. The fringe-eared oryx also has a black tail and long, straight horns.
Length: 152-170cm
Height: 115-140cm
Weight: 167-209kg
Interesting Fact: Due to specially adapted kidneys, fringe-eared oryx can go weeks without water.
This is the only antelope that is born with horns, appearing as tiny bumps at birth.
Found In: Arid grasslands, forested savannas, semi desert plains, thick brush, near rocky hillsides.

name: Galah
description:
The galah has a grayish-red eye ring, a white forehead and crown suffused with pink, gray upper parts, rose pink undersides, and a gray tail and lower abdomen.
Length: 36cm
Found In: Woodlands, open shrublands, grasslands, parks.

name: Galapagos dove
description:
The Galapagos dove is mainly reddish-brown with black, white, and incandescent green colors. It also has a turquoise eye ring.
Length: 19-23cm
Interesting Fact: During rainstorms, the Galapagos dove will rain-bathe, where they lift one wing so that the underside will catch rain.
Found In: Drier parts of the main Galapagos Islands..

name: Galapagos hawk
description:
The Galapagos hawk is brown-black in color with a darker crown. Mantle feathers are edged with pale brown, gray, or buff. The hawk has gray and black barring on the tail, white barring on the wings, a grayish bill, and yellow legs and feet.
Length: 53-58cm
Interesting Fact: Only 150 breeding pairs can be found in the wild.

name: Galapagos penguin
description:
The forehead, crown, sides of the head, and throat of the Galapagos penguin are brownish-black. It has a narrow white line running from the eyes to the throat. During its breeding season, the penguin has a bare pink area at the base of the bill and eye. Its upper parts and tail are brownish-black, chin and underparts are white with black spots on breast, and it has two black bands across its upper chest.
Height: 21-23cm
Found In: Lowlands of volcanic coastal desert.

name: Galapagos sea lion
description:
The Galapagos sea lion has a dark chestnut brown coloration.
Length: male: 220cm, female: 180cm
Weight: male: 275kg, female: 91kg
Interesting Fact: Because of its trainability, the Galapagos sea lion is the most commonly seen species in marine shows.
Found In: Coasts and islands

name: Galapagos tortoise
description:
The carapace (shell) shape of the Galapagos tortoise varies by habitat.
Length: 182cm
Weight: 227kg
Interesting Fact: Only 15,000 Galapagos tortoises are left in the wild. They are the largest living tortoise species.
Found In: Tropical deciduous forests, scrub forests, savannas, and grasslands.

name: Gambel's quail
description:
The male Gambel's quail has a black crest, forehead, and face. The crown is chestnut and the face is bordered with white. The male also has blue-gray upper parts and a yellowish belly with a black center. The female Gambel's quail, on the other hand, has a dark brown crest, gray upper parts, chestnut flanks with white streaks, and a pale belly.
Length: 21.5cm
Found In: Urban areas, desert canyons.

name: Gaur
description:
The gaur is dark brown with paler lower legs. It has a dewlap that hangs from the chin to between the front legs, a shoulder hump, and horns on both sexes.
Length: 250-330cm
Height: 170-220cm
Weight: 700-1000kg
Interesting Fact: The only predators of the gaur are tigers and leopards.
Found In: Tropical woodlands.

name: Grant's Gazelle
description:
Grant's gazelle is mostly a reddish-tan color with white undersides, a white rump patch with black border, a white face stripe framed in black from the horns to the muzzle, and a black side stripe. Unusually, horns are found in both sexes.
Length: 152-182cm
Height: 75-91.5cm
Weight: 45-65kg
A single calf is born to each female during the rainy season following a gestation period of six months.
Found In: Semi deserts, open savannas, treeless plains.

name: Gecko
description:
The gecko is well-known for its large protruding eyes, fleshy tongue, thin velvety skin, and toe pads. Its colorings are brown, yellow, or gray and have variable markings.
Length: 5-40cm
Interesting Fact: There are 80 genera and more than 670 known species of geckos.
Found In: Deserts to rain forests.

name: Gelada baboon
description:
The coat of the gelada baboon is brown and becomes paler at the ends. This baboon has a mane, a long shoulder cape, a patch of naked red skin at the base of neck and chest, and a naked red rump.
Length: 50-74cm
Weight: 14-21kg
Interesting Fact: These are the only primates that graze.
Found In: Grasslands, scrublands, woodlands.

name: Gemsbok
description:
The gemsbok is fawn in color with white undersides. It has white and black face markings and a black line running down its throat and across the flanks. The tail is black, and the gemsbok has long straight horns.
Length: 153-170cm
Height: 120cm
Weight: 162-200kg
Found In: Arid regions, deserts.

name: Gerbil
description:
The coat color of the gerbil varies, but the tail tip is a contrasting color.
Interesting Fact: An individual's coat color matches the color of the ground where it lives. There are 34 known species of gerbil.
Found In: Deserts, semi deserts, coastal areas.

name: Gerenuk
description:
The gerenuk is reddish-brown with a darker back and white around the eyes and white undersides. The legs and neck are long, and horns are found only on the males.
Length: 140-160cm
Height: 80-105cm
Weight: 29-52kg
Interesting Fact: The name gerenuk means giraffe-necked in Somali.
Found In: Deserts, dry bush savannas.

name: Giant anteater
description:
The coat of the giant anteater is gray-brown with a diagonal black and white shoulder stripe. The tail is long and bushy, and the foreclaws are long and powerful.
Length: 1-1.2m
Interesting Fact: Female anteaters give birth standing on their hind legs, using their tails as third legs for support.
Found In: Forests, savannas.

name: Giant armadillo
description:
The giant armadillo is characterized by the armored and moveable plates along its back. It also has long claws on its forefeet.
Length: 75-100cm
Weight: up to 60kg
Interesting Fact: The front claws can be up to 20 cm long. The mouth holds 100 small teeth that shed as the armadillo ages.
Found In: Forests.

name: Goliath heron
description:
The goliath heron has a dark bill, black legs and feet, a rufous head and neck, purplish-chestnut underparts, a gray back and wings, and a white breast, throat, cheeks and chin. The goliath heron also has black streaking on its breast.
Length: 135-150cm
Interesting Fact: This is the largest species of heron.
Found In: Rivers; lakes; swamps.

name: Giant otter
description:
The coat coloring of the giant otter is a dark burnt umber. Its chin, throat, and chest are marked with cream-colored patches.
Length: 96-123cm
Weight: 22-32kg
Interesting Fact: This is the largest species of otter. They are often referred to as 'river wolves'.
Found In: Freshwater rivers, slow streams, lakes.

name: Gila monster
description:
The gila monster has bead-like scales with orange, yellow, and black patterns. Its tail is short and stout.
Length: 45-61cm
Interesting Fact: The tail is used for fat storage. Gila monsters are one of two species of venomous lizards. The venom enters the jaw via grooved teeth on the bottom jaw as the lizard chews. Envenomation can be fatal, affecting the victim's nervous system.
Found In: Arid and semiarid regions.

name: Giraffe
description:
The giraffe has a light coat with irregular dark spots. The exact coloration varies by location. The giraffe has one or two pairs of skin-covered horns and a long tuft of hair at the tip of its tail.
Length: 3.8-4.7m
Height: 3.3m
Weight: 550-1930kg
Interesting Facts: The skull of a male is continuously laying down bone. Therefore, as the giraffe ages, more bumps appear on his head. A giraffe's tongue can be up to 46 cm long, enabling it to pull leaves off trees. The spots on the coat are like a fingerprint - no two giraffes have the exact same pattern. Giraffes fall into deep sleep, with their necks on the ground, for only five minutes a day; the neck is held vertically otherwise.
Found In: Savannas.

name: Glossy ibis
description:
The glossy ibis' plumage is all dark chestnut. The wings are glossy green, and its face is bare with a white outline. The ibis also hasbrown eyes.
Length: 56-64cm
Found In: Marshes, rice fields, swamps.

name: Glossy starling
description:
The glossy starling has a glossy blue or green back. The ventral side is either dull or brownish-yellow. The length of the tail is variable.
Interesting Fact: Lamprotornis is the largest genus of African starlings.

name: Goanna lizard
description:
The goanna lizard has an elongated neck and round pupils.
Length: 20-300cm
Weight: 20-150kg
Interesting Fact: There are over 30 known species of goanna.

name: Golden eagle
locations: Western parts of Central North America
description:
The female golden eagle is larger than the male. The feathers are dark brown, the head and neck are amber and tan, and the wings are mottled with buff-white. The beak is black and the feet are yellow.
Length: 81cm
Weight: 3-6kg
Interesting Fact: A breeding pair of golden eagles will need more than 270 kilograms of food per year.
Found In: Mountainous regions, plains.

name: Golden jackal
description:
The coat of the golden jackal is either pale golden brown or yellow tipped with brown. The underside is more pale and the tip of the tail is black.
Length: 60-106cm
Height: 38-50cm
Weight: 7-15kg
Found In: Open country with trees and brush.

name: Golden-mantled ground squirrel
description:
The golden-mantled ground squirrel is a golden brown color with a tawny or russet mantle on the head and shoulders. It has a white stripe down the side of its back bordered by black, and white fur around its eyes.
Length: 22-32cm
Weight: 120-394g
Found In: Mountains, mixed or coniferous forests.

name: Greylag goose
description:
Greylag geese have gray feathers and a bright orange or pink bill and eye rings.
Length: 75-90cm
Interesting Fact: This species is an ancestor of the domestic goose.
Found In: Grasslands, farmlands, lakes, rivers.

name: Gray heron
description:
The gray heron has gray feathers, a whitish foreneck and breast with dark streaking, and a black crown band and shoulders.
Length: 90-98cm
The rainy season signals the start of the breeding season. Each pair lays 3-5 eggs.The rainy season signals the start of the breeding season. Each pair lays 3-5 eggs.
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Greater rhea
description:
Greater rheas resemble ostriches, but they have softer body plumage, longer wings, and they lack tail plumes. Their thighs, head, and neck are covered in brown feathers; their wing feathers are white-tipped.
Length: 152cm
Weight: 23kg
Interesting Fact: Greater rheas are the largest bird species in South America. They cannot fly.
Found In: Open country with some tall vegetation.

name: Great egret
description:
The great egret has white plumage, a long neck, a blue lores, a large black bill, and a black line from the bill to behind the eyes.
Length: 65-72cm
Found In: Inland and coastal waters.

name: Great horned owl
description:
The great horned owl is reddish-brown to gray or black and has white feathers. Its undersides are light gray with dark bars, and the upper breast has a white band. The owl has large yellow eyes surrounded by a orange-buff facial disc. Tufts of feathers on the head make the owl look like it has horns, hence the name.
Length: 46-64cm
Weight: 0.9-1.8kg
Found In: Every type of woodland, farmland, desert with scrub, mountainous area, mangroves and urban areas.

name: Great kiskadee
description:
The tail and wings of the great kiskadee are rufous-colored, and the underparts and crown are bright yellow. Its face is black and white.
Found In: Streamside thickets, groves, orchards, towns, open woodlands.

name: Great skua
description:
The great skua is mostly dark to reddish-brown streaked with ochre or rufous. Its underside is uniformly colored. Its cap is brownish-black, and it has white wing flashes.
Length: 51-66cm
Interesting Fact: Great skuas will often chase other birds to steal their food.
Found In: Upland moors and grasslands, high sea cliffs.

name: Greater adjutant stork
description:
