The adult breeding adjutant stork has a bluish-gray mantle, a silvery-gray panel across its greater coverts, gray underwing-coverts, and a more extensive white neck ruff. The adult non-breeding or immature stork has a darker gray mantle and inner wing-coverts, and brown greater coverts. The adjutant stork also has a neck pouch that is only visible when inflated.
Length: 120-150cm
Interesting Fact: The adjutant stork flies with its neck retracted, not outstretched like most birds.
Found In: Marshes, lakes.

name: Greater blue-eared
description:
The greater blue-eared starling has blue-black feathers tinged with green, a patch around the eyes, and bright orange eyes.
Length: 22cm
Found In: Open bushlands, woodlands, urban areas.

name: Greater flamingo
description:
The greater flamingo has dark pink feathers with black primaries and secondaries. The legs are pink and the bill is pink with a black tip.
Length: 106cm
Height: 110-130cm
Weight: 3.5kg
Found In: Tropical and subtropical regions, large lakes and lagoons.

name: Greater kudu
description:
The coat of the greater kudu is a reddish-sandy color with four to eleven white vertical stripes on the flanks. The kudu has white facial spots and a broad white nasal stripe. Males have a dewlap hanging from their throat. Both sexes have horns, but the horns of the males are much longer.
Length: 135cm
Weight: 215-315kg

name: Greater roadrunner
description:
The roadrunner is mottled black and white. It has a small crest on its head, and its tail and legs are long.
Length: 50-60cm
Height: 25-30.5cm
Weight: 200-700g
Roadrunners form permanent bond between a breeding pair.
Interesting Fact: Roadrunners can run up to 15 mph.
Found In:Semiarid open country.

name: Greater sage
locations: Western parts of Central North America
description:
The male greater sage grouse has a yellow comb over its eye, a black/brown throat with a v-shaped mark separated by white feathers, and a white breast. The nape, back, and wings are gray and speckled with white. The male also has a black belly and olive air sacs on his chest. The female has a buff throat with black markings, and a lower throat and breast barred with black/brown. Her plumage is mottled with white and brown, and the belly is dark.
Length: 56cm
Found In: Scrub grasslands.

name: Green-backed heron
description:
The green heron has a green-black cap, a chestnut face and neck, deep green upperparts, and dark undersides. Its eyes are yellow-orange, and its legs are either yellow or green. The green heron also has a long neck.
Length: 43-55cm
Interesting Fact: This is the smallest heron species in North America.
Found In: Mangroves, estuaries, coral reefs, rocky coasts, rivers, lakes, ponds.

name: Green vine snake
description:
The head of the green vine snake is slender, elongated, and pointed.
Length: 150cm
Interesting Fact: This species is mildly venomous.
Found In: Tropical forests.

name: Grey fox
description:
The grey fox has a gray agouti coat, a white throat, and a black-tipped mane along the top of its tail.
Length: 52-69cm
Height: 30-41cm
Weight: 2.5-7kg
Interesting Fact: The gray fox can climb trees.
Found In: Woodlands, brush country, rocky terrain.

name: Grey lourie
description:
The grey lourie has gray plumage, a long tail and crest, and black legs and feet. The female has a colorful green beak, and the male has a black beak.
Length: 50cm
Found In: Dry and open woodlands.

name: Grey mouse lemur
description:
The grey mouse lemur is gray in color with a paler underside. It also has long fleshy ears.
Length: 12-14cm
Weight: 50-90g
Found In: Secondary forests, roadside brush, gardens.

name: Grey phalarope
description:
The summer female grey phalarope is black with ochre stripes running down the back. She also has a black cap, white cheeks, and brownish-red underparts. The summer male is similar but has a streaked crown and less white on his face. The winter colors are the same for both sexes: slate blue, a white head, a dark spot above the eye, stripe down the nape, and white underparts.
Length: 20-23cm
Found In: Tundra, wet meadows, sea.

name: Griffon vultures
description:
The griffon vulture is a dark buff color. The head and neck have short white feathers, and the neck is long and white. Its flight feathers and tail are dark brown.
Length: 95-105cm
Found In: Open hillsides, mountainsides, plains.

name: Grizzly bear
description:
The coat color of the grizzly bear can vary from yellowish-brown to black. This animal has a large muscular hump over its shoulders.
Length: 1.8-2.13m
Height: 1.3m
Weight: 147-680kg
Found In: River valleys, mountain forests, open meadows.

name: Guanaco
description:
The guanaco has a fawn brown top with white undersides. Its neck is long and thin.
Length: 176-202cm
Height: 110-115cm
Weight: 120kg
Found In: Dry open country in mountains and plains, cold and temperate regions.

name: Harbor seal
description:
The harbor seal is light gray or brown in color with black or lighter-colored spots.
Length: 152-182cm
Weight: 113kg
Found In: Coasts near river inlets.

name: Hawk-headed parrot
description:
The hawk-headed parrot has red feathers tipped in blue on neck ruff, breast, and belly. Its crown and forehead are a dusky white color. The wings and back are dark green.
Length: 35cm
Weight: 190-274g
Found In: Lowland rainforests.

name: Helmeted guineafowl
description:
The helmeted guineafowl has a bare head and neck and black feathers that are uniformly spotted with white.
Length: 43-73cm
Weight: 1.3kg
Found In: Grasslands, forest edges, wooded ravines, hillsides.

name: Herring gull
description:
The herring gull is white with a light gray back and wings. Its wingtips are black with white spots. The gull also has a red spot on its lower beak and pink feet.
Length: 58-66cm
Weight: 500-1500g
Found In: Ocean coasts, bays, beaches, lakes, farmlands.

name: Hippopotamus
description:
The skin color of the hippopotamus varies from blue-gray to brown.
Height: 139-160cm
Weight: 1136-2636kg
Found In: Large river and lake areas.

name: Hoary marmot
description:
The fur of the hoary marmot is gray mottled with black and white. It has dark leg extremities and a white mantle across its back.
Length: 62-82cm
Weight: 4-9kg
Found In: Alpine tundra above the timberline.

name: Honey badger
description:
The honey badger is black with a gray mantle and white edges covering its back, head, and shoulders.
Length: 60-102cm
Height: 23-30cm
Weight: 5.5-14kg
Found In: Plains, mountains, arid scrub, deserts, forests, rainforests.

name: Horned lark
description:
The horned lark is mostly yellow with a black head that has short black tufts on either side, giving the appearance of horns. Its wings and back are brown, and the undersides are white. The lark's chest band is black, but the female has less black.
Length: 16-17cm
Weight: 31g
Found In: Prairies, fields, urban areas, tundra, shores.

name: Horned puffin
description:
The chest, face, and undersides of the horned puffin are white. Its back and neck are black, and the bill is orange with a red tip. The puffin's eyes are surrounded with black 'horns,' and there is a fleshy horn above the eyes.
Length: 32cm
Weight: 580-650g
Found In: Open ocean, sea cliffs, rocky islets.

name: Hottentot teal
description:
Hottentot teals have a grayish-blue bill, a black cap down to their eyes, and yellow cheeks. Their coloration is a mottled yellow and black with black wings.
Length: 30-35cm
Weight: 200g
Found In: Shallow swamps and marshes.

name: House crow
description:
The house crow has black body feathers glossed with metallic violet. Its wings are black with a green-violet gloss, and the eyes are brown.
Length: 43-53cm
Weight: 500g
Found In: Woodlands, rural and urban areas.

name: House sparrow
description:
The male house sparrow is brownish-black with black streaks. Its crown is gray with red sides, and the nape is red. The house sparrow has white cheeks and a black chin and chest. Females, however, have a gray-brown crown with a light brown eye stripe. From the throat to the belly is a gray-brown color.
Length: 14.5cm
Weight: 24-40g
Found In: Urban areas, woodlands.

name: Hudsonian godwit
description:
The Hudsonian godwit has a long upturned bill, black wings with white bases, a white rump, a dark tail and legs, gray upperparts, and white underparts.
Length: 33cm
Weight: 250g
Found In: Tundra, mudflats, marshes.

name: Hyrax
description:
The hyrax is very similar to rabbits but with short, rounded ears. Some of its distinguishing features include feet with flattened nails that resemble hooves, a short tail, and no sexual dimorphism with size.
Length: 50cm
Weight: 3kg
Found In: Rocky outcrops, cliffs, forests.

name: Ibex
description:
The ibex is uniformly brown. Both sexes have long thick horns, and the male has a small chin beard.
Length: 115-170cm
Height: 65-105cm
Weight: 30-100kg
Found In: Alpine desert.

name: Impala
description:
Impalas have a light mahogany coat, a white belly, fawn flanks, black vertical stripes on its tail and thighs, and a black glandular tuft on the fetlocks. Only the male impalas have horns.
Length: 128-142cm
Height: 86-91cm
Weight: 45-80kg
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Indian peacock
description:
Both sexes of the Indian peacock have a fan-shaped crest of feathers on the head, a white patch under the eyes, and a long slender neck. Males are known for their long colorful trains with eyespots. Female peacocks are brown with some metallic green plumage.
Length: 86-120cm
Weight: 3-6kg
Found In: Forests, semi open country.

name: Indian porcupine
description:
The Indian porcupine has sharp black spines, long black and white hair on its back, a grayish crest, and a short tail.
Length: 60-83cm
Weight: 13-27kg
Found In: Rocky hillsides, tropical and temperate scrublands, grasslands, forests.

name: Indian red admiral
description:
This butterfly has scales on its four wings, clubs on the ends of its antennae, and a coiled proboscis.
Found In: Flowery banks, Woodland boarders.

name: Indian star tortoise
description:
The Indian star tortoise has a grayish-brown shell with a star pattern in cream or golden brown. Its carapace is elongated with elevated plates.
Length: 25cm
Weight: 1.3-2.2kg
Found In: Dry lowland forests, high grassy jungles.

name: Indian treepie
description:
The Indian treepie has a slate gray hood, buff underparts and rump, a pale gray wing panel, and a black tail tip.
Length: 46-50cm
Weight: 90-120g
Found In: Woodlands, scrub jungles, urban areas.

name: Jabiru stork
description:
The jabiru stork has white feathers, red and black naked skin on its neck and head, and a yellow bill.
Length: 145cm
Height: 152cm
Weight: 4kg
Found In: Savannas, coastal lagoons, marshes.

name: Jaguar
description:
The jaguar has a yellowish-brown coloration that can vary from white to black. It also has black spots on its belly that become rosettes on the back. The tail tip, lower jaw, and outer surface of the ears are black.
Length: 110-185cm
Height: 68-76cm
Weight: 57-138kg
Found In: Tropical forests, swamps, open country, deserts, savannas.

name: Jaguarundi
description:
The jaguarundi has two color phases, a gray and a red phase. In the gray phase, the jaguarundi has a salt and pepper coat with grizzled underparts. The red phase consists of a black coat with red underparts, brown legs, and a white throat and lips. Also, the legs of the jaguarundi are short.
Length: 55-67cm
Weight: 5.5-10kg
Found In: Dense thickets, forest edges.

name: Japanese macaque
description:
The long fur of the Japanese macaque ranges from brown to white in coloration. Its facial skin is naked and bright red. The macaque also has a relatively short tail.
Length: 47-60cm
Weight: 8-18kg
Found In: Forested hills, highlands, mountains.

name: Jungle cat
description:
The jungle cat has a short tail, long legs, tapered ears, and a sandy brown to yellow fur color. This cat occasionally has dark stripes on its face and legs.
Length: 50-75cm
Height: 35-38cm
Weight: 4-16kg
Found In: Dry forests, woodlands, scrub, reed beds, urban areas.

name: Kaffir cat
description:
The kaffir cat has long legs and a medium brown coat with black stripes.
Length: 55-65cm
Weight: 5-6kg

name: Kafue flats lechwe
description:
The kafue flats lechwe has chestnut upperparts with white undersides, throat, and facial markings. Its legs are dark and the body can be black to red in color. The horns are relatively thin.
Length: 130-170cm
Height: 90-112cm
Weight: 61-128kg
Found In: Floodplains, tropical deciduous forests, scrub forests, tropical savannas, grasslands.

name: Kalahari scrub robin
description:
The top of the kalahari scrub robin's head is grayish-brown. Its mantle, scapulars, and rump are a dull russet. The flight feathers are black with buff edges. The kalahari scrub robin's tail is tawny and black in color and is tipped with white. The eyes have a white and black stripe. Its underparts are uniformly buff or buff-white.
Length: 16cm
Weight: 20g
Found In: Open scrub, open woodlands, savannah.

name: King cormorant
description:
The king cormorant has black feathers, a long hooked bill, a long thin neck and tail, and their gular area is pointed and yellow. The king cormorant has a white patch on its flank.
Length: 75cm
Weight: 2.6kg
Found In: Coastal and freshwater areas.

name: King vulture
description:
Identification: The king vulture is a medium-sized vulture with a white breast, white wing coverts, black secondary and primary feathers, and a yellowish to red bald head.
Length: 79cm
Weight: 3.4kg
Found In: Tropical forest, savannah.

name: Kinkajou
description:
The kinkajou is identified by its short deep golden coat and prehensile tail.
Length: 41-57cm
Weight: 1.4-2.7kg
Found In: Tropical forests.

name: Kirk's dik-dik
description:
Kirk's dik dik is a whitish-gray color with white underparts, a white ring around eye, and an elongated nose. Males have small horns, but in this species females are slightly larger than males.
Length: 60-72cm
Height: 35-43cm
Weight: 4.5-6kg
Found In: Open grasslands, deserts, rocky outcrops.

name: Klipspringer
description:
The ears of the klipspringer are round with black borders. Its coat is yellow and interspersed with gray. Its horns are nearly vertical.
Length: 60-72cm
Height: 44-53cm
Weight: 10-50kg
Found In: Well-drained grassland with clumps of brush.

name: Knob-nosed duck
description:
A leaf-shaped comb sits on the male knob-nosed goose's bill. The male also has a dark back glossed with purple, bronze, and green. His head is a creamy white color, spotted black, and the hind neck has a hint of orange. The female duck is less glossy, and she has no comb or spots on her head.
Length: 56-76cm
Weight: 1-3kg
Found In: Wooded wetlands.

name: Koala
description:
The koala has a gray to tawny coat. It has white patches on its chin, chest, forelimbs, and rump.
Length: 60-85cm
Weight: 5-12kg
Found In: Eucalypt forests below 600m in elevation.

name: Kongoni
description:
The kongoni has a sandy fawn coat color, a white or pale rump, and a dark fringe on its tail. Unlike most horned-animals, both sexes have horns.
Length: 2.1m
Height: 1.2m
Weight: 120-150kg
Found In: Grassy plains, open scrublands, lightly wooded areas.

name: Kori bustard
description:
The kori bustard has dull gray to brown feathers, white undersides, and a brown feather topknot.
Height: 1.2m
Weight: 22.7kg
Found In: Grasslands and semi-deserts.

name: Land iguana
description:
The land iguana has patches of white, black, brown, and rust-colored scales.
Length: 1m
Weight: 13kg
Found In: Dry areas of the islands.

name: Lappet-faced vulture
description:
The lappet-faced vulture has dark brown plumage, whitish patches on the sides of the breast, a white band at the leading edge of the underwing, white legs, and a mottled black and white breast. The head and neck are covered in pale bare skin.
Length: 95-105cm
Found In: Desert hills, plains.

name: Large cormorant
description:
The large cormorant has black feathers, a long neck and bill, a white face and chin, and white thigh patches.
Length: 90cm
Weight: 2.6-3.7kg
Found In: Coasts, estuaries, lakes, rivers.

name: Large-eared bushbaby
description:
The large-eared bushbaby has a gray coat.
Length: 76cm
Weight: 1.2kg
Found In: Forests, wooded grasslands.

name: Laughing dove
description:
The laughing dove has a brownish-pink head and underparts. The upperparts, however, are uniformly colored. The dove also has a black stippling on its upper breast and a long tail.
Length: 27cm
Weight: 82g
Found In: Semi deserts, scrublands.

name: Laughing kookaburra
description:
The laughing kookaburra has mostly brown feathers with a paler underside. There are black bands on its tail.
Length: 45cm
Weight: 300g
Found In: Forests.

name: Lava gull
description:
The lava gull is dark gray with a black head and wings. There is white around its eyes, and the eyelids are red.
Length: 51-55cm
Weight: 380g
Found In: Inshore waters.

name: Least chipmunk
description:
The least chipmunk has a brown coat with black and white stripes running down its back and sides. It also has white stripes about and below its eyes.
Length: 185-222mm
Weight: 42-53g
Found In: Temperate forests, rock cliffs and bluffs.

name: Leopard
description:
The coat color of the leopard may range from pale cream to tawny brown. Black or brown rosettes are found on the back and upper limbs, turning into solid spots on the face, lower limbs, and undersides.
Length: 104-190cm
Weight: 28-90kg
Found In: Areas with heavy vegetation for cover.

name: Lesser flamingo
description:
The lesser flamingo has a deep red bill with a black tip. Its eyes are dark red and the facial skin is bare. Its plumage is bright pink, and it may have a crimson breast. The flight feathers are black.
Length: 80-105cm
Weight: 1.2-2.7kg
Found In: Lakes, coastal lagoons, tidal mudflats.

name: Lesser masked weaver
description:
The lesser masked weaver is yellow with an olive green mantle. The face and forecrown are black.
Length: 14cm
Found In: Dry thornbush, acacia woodlands, savannas.

name: Lilac-breasted roller
description:
The head, nape, and upper back of the lilac-breasted roller are greenish-brown. The lower back and scapulars are brown, and the shoulders, flight feathers, and rump are light blue. The roller's tail is bluish, and the long tail feathers are black. The breast is a rich lilac color and is lightly streaked with white.
Length: 28-38cm
Weight: 105g
Found In: Woodland and occasionally within grasslands.

name: Little cormorant
description:
The little cormorant is mostly black with white plumes on the forecrown and sides of the head. It has a slender, hooked bill and a white throat patch.
Length: 51cm
Found In: Inland and coast waters.

name: Little grebe
description:
The breeding plumage of the little grebe is a yellow gape, a chestnut face and neck, a powder puff rear end, brown sides mottled with white, white undersides, and a black back.
Length: 25cm
Weight: 170g
Found In: Shallow water habitats in temperate and tropical zones.

name: Llama
description:
The llama has a dense wool coat of variable color and markings.
Length: 1.2-2.2m
Height: 1.1-1.2m
Weight: 130-155kg
Found In: Alpine grasslands and shrublands at 2300 to 4000m elevation.

name: Long-billed corella
description:
The long-billed corella is mostly white. It has a long upper bill and bluish bare skin around its eyes. The long-billed corella's lores, forehead, and spots on throat and breast are either orange or red. It has pale yellow splashes on its underwing.
Length: 38-41cm
Weight: 550g
Found In: Woodlands, farmlands.

name: Long-crested hawk eagle
description:
The tarsal feathers of the long-crested hawk eagle are dark brown and white. It also has a long crest on its head.
Length: 50-60cm
Weight: 1000-1500g
Found In: Dense forests.

name: Long-finned pilot whale
description:
The pilot whale is dark brown to gray-black. It has a paler, anchor-shaped patch on its throat and chest and gray/white streaks behind its eyes and saddle patch. The dorsal fin of this whale is low and rounded, and the flippers are long and pointed.
Length: 5.5-6.3m
Weight: 1800-3500kg
Found In: Sub-polar and temperate oceans.

name: Long-necked turtle
description:
The long-necked turtle has an extremely long neck and a smooth oval carapace that is dark green or black in color.
Length: 20cm
Found In: Swamps, lakes, creeks.

name: Long-nosed bandicoot
description:
The long-nosed bandicoot has a gray-brown coloring on its back with a cream-colored belly. Its muzzle is long and pointed, and it also has a reverse pouch.
Length: 310-425mm
Weight: 850-1100g
Found In: Rainforest floor.

name: Long-tailed jaeger
description:
The long-tailed jaeger has a black cap with yellow underneath. Its back is dark gray, and its underparts, neck, and face are white. The legs are a bluish-gray color, and the tail has long streamers.
Length: 50-58cm
Weight: 300g
Found In: Large lakes.

name: Madagascar fruit bat
description:
The Madagascar fruit bat is a grayish brown or black color with yellowish-gray fur between its shoulders.
Length: 170-406mm
Weight: 300g
Found In: Forests, swamps.

name: Madagascar hawk owl
description:
The Madagascar hawk owl has no ear tufts, a rounded head, brown upperparts, whitish eyebrows, and light tan underparts barred with brown. Its abdomen is a plain whitish color.
Length: 23-30cm
Weight: 236g
Found In: Rainforests, deciduous forests, forest clearings.

name: Magellanic penguin
description:
Magellanic penguins have a black-brown back, a white breast and trunk, and two bold black stripes around their necks.
Length: 70cm
Weight: 3.5kg
Found In: Sub-Antarctic islands.

name: Magnificent frigate bird
description:
The frigate bird has long pointed wings and a forked tail. The male is mostly black with a red inflatable throat sac. The female is black with a white breast.
Length: 89cm
Weight: 1.5kg
Found In: Coasts and offshore islands.

name: Malabar squirrel
description:
The Malabar squirrel has a deep brown coat with buff-colored underparts.
Length: 35-40cm
Weight: 1.1kg
Found In: Deciduous, mixed deciduous, and moist evergreen forests.

name: Malachite kingfisher
description:
The malachite kingfisher is a colorful bird with bright blue upperparts, a green crown, a white stripe on the side of its neck, and orange-brown underparts and face.
Length: 14cm
Weight: 18g
Found In: Lakes, rivers and streams.

name: Mallard
description:
The male mallard has a blue speculum with white bars, silvery wing linings, a green head with a white ring around the neck, and a chestnut breast. The female mallard, however, is mottled brown and tan with a pale brown face.
Length: 45-68cm
Weight: 700-1600g
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Malleefowl
description:
The malleefowl is mottled black, brown, and gray. It also has a black stripe down the center of its breast.
Height: 60cm
Weight: 1.5-2kg
Found In: Arid and semiarid regions, eucalypt forests.

name: Manatee
description:
The manatee is gray with white patches on its chest and abdomen. Its body is covered with fine hair and bristles.
Length: 2.5-3m
Weight: 300-500kg
Found In: Lakes, oxbows and lagoons with dense vegetation.

name: Madras tree shrew
description:
The madras tree shrew is brown with a pale stripe on each shoulder. Its ears are relatively large.
Length: 16-18cm
Weight: 160g
Found In: Rain forests, woodlands.

name: Mara
description:
The mara is brown with a dark rump, a white belly and rump base, and long ears.
Length: 75cm
Weight: 8kg
Found In: Scrublands and deserts.

name: Marabou stork
description:
The marabou stork has a naked pink head and neck, a long dangling throat sac, black and white plumage, and a white ruff at the base of the neck.
Height: 1.5m
Weight: 4.5-8kg
Found In: Savannas, plains, marshes.

name: Margay
description:
The margay has a yellow-brown coat with dark spots, tail rings, and a white belly.
Length: 40-80cm
Height: 63-68cm
Weight: 2-3kg
Found In: Forests, scrublands.

name: Marine iguana
description:
The marine iguana has gray to black colorations.
Length: 60-100cm
Weight: 600-1500g
Found In: Volcanic islands, steep cliffs near ocean.

name: Meerkat
description:
The coat of the meerkat can be tan to gray with dark brown stripes running across the back and sides, a whitish head and throat, and black ears and tail tip.
Length: 29cm
Weight: 900g
Interesting Fact: Meerkats are not permitted in the United States because they are related to the Indian mongoose, which has had a severe impact on the poultry population in the west Indian islands.
Found In: Open savannas, dry areas.

name: Mexican beaded lizard
description:
The beaded lizard has pale yellow dots on otherwise black skin. It has a broad head, a thick rounded tail, and a fleshy tongue.
Length: Up to 80cm
Weight: 1.4-2kg
Found In: Open dry forests.

name: Mexican boa
description:
The Mexican boa has dull colorations.
Length: 122-152cm

name: Mexican wolf
description:
The Mexican wolf's coat varies from gray to rusty brown.
Length: 137-167cm
Height: 66-81cm
Weight: 23-41kg
Found In: Mountain woodlands.

name: Mississippi alligator
description:
The American alligator is generally black with yellowish cross bands that become less apparent with age.
Length: 3-6m
Found In: Freshwater ponds, lakes, rivers, swamps.

name: Mocking cliff chat
description:
The male mocking cliff chat is black with white shoulders and chestnut underparts. The female is gray with no white patch.
Length: 22cm
Weight: 51g
Found In: Cliffs and hillsides, urban areas.

name: Moose
description:
The moose has a black-brown coat and large, branched antlers. A flap of skin and hair hanging from the throat, known as a bell, is also a distinctive feature.
Height: 168-230cm
Weight: 400-800kg
Found In: Forested areas with lakes, ponds and swamps.

name: Mouflon
description:
The mouflon has a dark chestnut coat with a lighter saddle and a distinct rump patch. It also has a dark ruff, a short broad tail, and horns that are present in both sexes (longer in the male).
Length: 110-130cm
Height: 65-75cm
Weight: 25-55kg
Found In: Low rocky areas.

name: Mountain duck
description:
The mountain duck is blue-gray in color with a chestnut-speckled breast, yellowish eyes, and a pale pink bill with a black edge.
Found In: Rivers, streams.

name: Mountain goat
description:
The undercoat of the mountain goat is thick and woolly, and the upper coat is longer. The horns are black, and the goat also has a spongy inner pad on its hoof for gripping rocks.
Length: 1.2-1.8m
Found In: Rocky mountains, above the tree line.

name: Mountain lion
description:
The coat of the mountain lion can range from tawny to gray-brown in color.
Length: 99-160cm
Weight: 67-103kg
Found In: Mountains, forests, swamps, grasslands.

name: Mourning collared dove
description:
The mourning collared dove has a gray forehead, crown, and sides of its face. It also has a black half collar on the hind neck, light orange eyes, bare red skin around the eyes, a pale belly, and brown upperparts.
Length: 30cm
Found In: Urban areas, open country.

name: Mule deer
description:
The mule deer has a red summer coat and a brown-gray winter coat. It has a black bar around its chin, a black patch on its forehead, and a black tail tip. Its face, throat, belly, and rump patch are white.
Height: 102cm
Weight: 120kg
Found In: Grasslands, woodlands.

name: Mudskipper
description:
The mudskipper is very unique because it has limb-like pectoral fins which make it capable of living both in and out of the water. It also has periscope-like eyes.
Length: 10cm
Found In: Mangrove swamps, mud flats, rocky shores.

name: Muskox
description:
The coat of the muskox is black with a lighter saddle and front. Its hair is dense and long. Both sexes have long, curving horns.
Length: 180-245cm
Height: 110-145cm
Weight: 350-650kg
Found In: Arctic tundra near glaciers.

name: Native cat
description:
The coat of the native cat is either black or fawn with white spots. There are no spots on the tail.
Length: 28-45cm
Weight: 700-2000g
Found In: Dry forests, shrubs, heathlands.

name: Neotropic cormorant
description:
The neotropic cormorant is black and glossed with olive. It has an orange throat pouch bordered with white.
Length: 64cm
Weight: 1.2-1.4kg
Found In: Tidal waters, lakes.

name: Nilgai
description:
The nilgai is reddish brown. Males have short horns and a tuft of hair on their throat.
Length: 2m
Height: 120-150cm
Weight: 120-240kg
Found In: Forests, low jungles.

name: Nine banded armadillo
description:
The carapace of the nine-banded armadillo usually has nine bands, but can have anywhere from seven to eleven. It also has a painted head and sharp claws.
Length: 45-50cm
Weight: 3-7kg
Found In: Arid grasslands, semi deserts.

name: North American beaver
description:
Beavers have a dense, dark brown fur. Their feet are webbed.
Length: 70-130cm
Height: 30-60cm
Weight: 27kg
Found In: Rivers and lakes in woodlands.

name: North American porcupine
description:
The North American porcupine's body is covered with long guard hairs and quills.
Length: 45-55cm
Weight: 3-7kg
Found In: Forests.

name: North American red fox
description:
The coloring of the North American red fox can vary from pale yellowish-red to deep reddish-brown.
Length: 45-84cm
Weight: 4-5kg
Found In: Woodlands, open country, urban areas.

name: North American river otter
description:
The North American river otter's coat is gray-brown to red-black in color. Its undersides are pale in comparison and the feet are webbed.
Length: 66-107cm
Weight: 8kg
Found In: Rivers, streams, swamps, marshes.

name: Northern elephant seal
description:
The Northern elephant seal is tan to gray in color. Some unusual characteristics include no external ears, no spots on their body, and their hind flippers cannot curl forward. Males have a large snout.
Length: 1.8-4.8m
Weight: 900-2300kg
Found In: Warm waters.

name: Northern fur seal
description:
The color of the northern fur seal can vary from gray to black to reddish to dark brown.
Length: 1.5-2.1m
Weight: 50-270kg
Found In: Oceans, coasts.

name: Numbat
description:
The numbat is red to black in color with lighter bands along the back. It also has black stripes across its eyes.
Length: 17-27cm
Weight: 300-700g
Found In: Forests.

name: Nyala
description:
The nyala is reddish brown in color. Males have horns and a white facial chevron.
Length: 1.4-2m
Weight: 88kg
Found In: Dense lowland forests, thickets in savannas, near water.

name: Ocelot
description:
The ocelot is gray to buff in color with black spots, rings, and stripes.
Length: 95-130cm
Height: 40-50cm
Weight: 11-16kg
Found In: Humid forests, thick brush, marshy areas.

name: Onager
description:
The onager is gray to fawn in color.
Length: 2m
Weight: 230kg
Found In: Steppes, gorges, river margins.

name: Orca
locations: All oceans, biggest populations are found in Arctic and Antarctic Oceans
description:
Orcas are black with white patches above their eyes. A gray saddle is behind their dorsal fin, and their undersides are white.
Length: 5-8m
Weight: 1300-5400kg
Found In: Oceans.

name: Oribi
description:
Oribi are yellow to red-brown in color with white undersides. They have a white stripe over each eye, a black-tipped tail, and a black patch of bare skin under their ears. Males have small horns.
Length: 91-107cm
Weight: 12-22kg
Found In: Wide grassy plains with low bushes near water.

name: Oriental white-backed vulture
description:
The white-backed vulture has blackish plumage with a contrasting white neck-ruff, lower back, and rump. The naked parts of its head, neck, and feet are dark.
Length: 75-85cm
Weight: 4.5kg
Found In: Open country, vicinity of abattoirs, cliffs, mostly lowlands up to 2,600 m.

name: Ornate rock dragon
description: N/A

name: Osprey
description:
The osprey has a white cap, a dark brown eye line, nape, back, and upperwings, and white underparts with barred black wings. Its wings are round-tipped.
Length: 56cm
Weight: 1.5kg
Found In: Wetland, lakes, rivers, coasts.

name: Ostrich
description:
The male ostrich has soft, curling black feathers with white primaries on the wings and tail. The females are brown, and both sexes have bare necks and legs.
Height: 1.8-2.7m
Weight: 114kg
Found In: Arid grassland.

name: Ovenbird
description:
The ovenbird has dull olive-brown upperparts, whitish underparts with a heavy dark streaking on the breast and flanks, and a rufous crown stripe bordered with a black lateral stripe.
Length: 14.5cm
Weight: 20g
Found In: Deciduous forests, mixed forests, coniferous forests, swamps.

name: Paca
description:
The paca has rough brown-black fur with four rows of white spots on each side of the body. Its body is stout with short legs and a small, thick head.
Length: 60-78cm
Weight: 6.3-10kg
Found In: Forests near water, tropics.

name: Pacific gull
description:
The Pacific gull has a white body with a black mantle and wings and a yellow bill with red tips. The wings of the gull have white edges, and the tail has a black band.
Length: 58-66cm
Weight: 900-1100g
Found In: Coastal areas.

name: Painted stork
description:
The painted stork is mostly white with black bars across its chest. The upperwings are black with white barring, and the bill is yellow. This stork has a bare face that can be orange, yellow, or red. Its legs are red in color.
Length: 93-100cm
Weight: 3.2kg
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Pale-throated three-toed sloth
description:
The pale-throated three-toed sloth is grayish-brown to beige in color and has a darker face.
Length: 50-60cm
Weight: 3.2-6.5kg
Found In: Forests.

name: Palm squirrel
description: N/A

name: Pampa gray fox
description:
The pampa gray fox is brindled gray with a paler underside.
Length: 62cm
Weight: 4.2-6.5kg
Found In: Pampas, hills, deserts.

name: Peregrine falcon
description:
The peregrine falcon has a black cap, gray upperparts, and a pale throat and breast. Its belly and underwings are barred, the wings are tapered, and the tail is slim.
Length: 38cm
Weight: 500-1500g
Found In: Mountains and sea cliffs.

name: Pied avocet
description:
The pied avocet has a fine, upcurved bill and has mostly white feathers with some black. Its cap and hind neck are black, and the legs are long and blue in color.
Length: 42-45cm
Weight: 300g
Found In: Coastal lagoons, lakes, estuaries.

name: Pied cormorant
description:
The pied cormorant is black with white on the sides of its neck, chest, and undersides. It has a blue eye ring and orange skin in front of its eyes.
Length: 70-75cm
Weight: 1.3-2.5kg
Found In: Coastal or inland lakes, rivers, estuaries.

name: Pied crow
description:
The pied crow is mostly black in color with a white hind neck, mantle, and breast.
Length: 45cm
Weight: 400-700g
Found In: Open grasslands, forests, urban areas.

name: Pied kingfisher
description:
The pied kingfisher is spotted and barred in black and white. It has a black breast band, a striped head pattern, and marbled upperparts.
Length: 24-26cm
Weight: 84g
Found In: Rivers, canals, lakes, ponds, marshes, coastal lagoons.

name: Pig-tailed macaque
description:
The pig-tailed macaque can be a variety of shades of brown with paler undersides and a darker face.
Length: 47-60cm
Weight: 4.8-8.3kg
Found In: Wet forests.

name: Pine siskin
description:
Although it looks much like a common sparrow, the pine siskin has dark streaking and patches of yellow on its wings and tail.
Length: 11-13cm
Weight: 13g
Found In: Mixed forests, grasslands.

name: Plains zebra
description:
The plains zebra has a white to yellowish coat with light to dark brown or black stripes. There is a great variation in stripe patterns among individuals and species. Zebras have a small erect mane that never falls to the side.
Length: 1.9-2.4m
Weight: 235kg
Found In: Grassy plains, lightly wooded savannas, hills.

name: Platypus
description:
A leathery bill, webbed feet, and a broad, flat tail are among the many distinguishing characteristics of the platypus. Also, males have ankle spurs.
Length: 46cm
Weight: 700-2400g
Found In: Lakes and rivers.

name: Polar bear
locations: Arctic Ocean to North America and Asia
description:
Polar bears have a thick white or yellowish coat.
Length: 2.2-2.5m
Weight: 175-650kg
Found In: Sea ice and waters, islands, coasts.

name: Prehensile-tailed porcupine
description:
The prehensile-tailed porcupine has relatively short spines, yellow to black coloration on its back, a gray belly, and no spines on its tail.
Length: 30-60cm
Weight: Up to 5kg
Found In: Forests.

name: Potoroo
description:
The color of the potoroo varies from red-brown to gray. Its belly fur is pale, and the tip of the tail is white.
Length: 30-40cm
Weight: 1.3kg
Found In: Dry woodlands to wet scrub.

name: Prairie falcon
description:
The prairie falcon has a dark brown cap and cheeks, a pale patch behind the eyes, a brown back and tail, and white underparts with dark bars and spots. This falcon also has a thin, dark 'moustache' under its bill.
Length: 40cm
Weight: 400-1100g
Found In: Treeless grasslands.

name: Pronghorn
description:
The upperbody of the pronghorn is tan, and the belly is white. It also has white areas between the shoulders and hips. A white shield and crescent are on the throat, and the rump is white. The males have black areas under their ears and a black face mask.
Length: 141cm
Height: 87cm
Weight: 47-70kg
Found In: Open grasslands and brushlands.

name: Puku
description:
The puku has a uniform brown coat with paler underparts. It also has white areas around the eyes and lips and a black rim around the ears. Males have ridged horns.
Length: 126-142cm
Height: 77-83cm
Weight: 62-90kg
Found In: Floodplain grasslands, near water.

name: Puna ibis
description:
The body of the puna ibis is dark purple-brown with green highlights. The head and neck are chestnut, and the wings and tail are green. The puna ibis has a long slender curving beak.
Height: 61cm
Weight: 1.4kg
Found In: Temperate high altitude zones, marshes, muddy flats.

name: Purple moorhen
description:
The purple moorhen is a purple-blue color and has long red legs and a red frontal shield.
Length: 47cm
Weight: 1kg
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Raccoon dog
description:
The hair of the raccoon dog is long and brindled with black and brown. Its face mask, legs, and tail stripes are black.
Length: 50-54cm
Height: 20cm
Weight: 7.5kg
Found In: Forests and rocky banks near rivers and lakes.

name: Radiated tortoise
description:
The radiated tortoise has black shell plates with yellow or orange centers. Four to twelve yellow or orange lines extend from each center point. The shell is high-domed, and the head is blunt. This tortoise's legs and feet are yellow, and the head is also yellow with a black patch.
Length: up to 40cm
Weight: 15kg
Found In: Dry brush, woodlands.

name: Rainbow lory
description:
The rainbow lory has a blue head, a red chest with orange/yellow speckling, and a green back, wings, and tail.
Length: 26cm
Weight: 120g
Found In: Forests, plantations, gardens, parks.

name: Red and blue macaw
description:
The red and blue macaw is deep crimson red color with rows of red feathers on its bald, white face. The wings are green and blue, and the rump and back are light blue. The tail is red but tipped with blue.
Length: 90cm
Weight: 1kg
Found In: Tropical lowlands.

name: Red brocket
description:
The red brocket has a red brown coat with a gray neck and white undersides. Males have spiked antlers.
Length: 70-130cm
Height: 71cm
Weight: 20kg
Found In: Forest thickets near water.

name: Red deer
description:
The red deer is red to grayish-brown in color, and its winter coat is darker. This deer also has a yellow rump patch and often has a dark caudal stripe on the rump. Only males have antlers.
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Red hartebeest
description:
The red hartebeest has a sandy fawn to bright reddish coat color. Unlike most horned-animals, both sexes have horns.
Length: 125-200cm
Height: 112-130cm
Weight: 126-183kg
Found In: Grassy plains.

name: Red howler monkey
description:
The red howler monkey has orange-brown fur and a prehensile tail with a naked underside at the tip. The male monkeys have beards.
Length: 46-72cm
Weight: 4.5-6.5kg
Found In: Forests, mangroves.

name: Red kangaroo
description:
The coat color of the red kangaroo varies from red to blue gray. The undersides are white and black, and there is a white patch on the sides of the muzzle. This kangaroo also has a white stripe that goes from its mouth to its ear.
Length: 75-140cm
Weight: 17-85kg
Found In: Grassy arid plains.

name: Red sheep
description:
The red sheep is light brown and has a white rump and legs. Its horns can be up to 190 cm long.
Length: 180-200cm
Height: 110-125cm
Weight: 95-140kg
Found In: Hilly terrain near high mountains.

name: Red squirrel
description:
The red squirrel is reddish-brown to gray-red and has black, lateral lines. The belly is white to gray.
Length: 270-390mm
Weight: 140-250g
Found In: Forests.

name: Red-billed buffalo weaver
description:
The red-billed buffalo weaver has a red bill and is black with white patches on the sides of the neck.
Length: 25cm
Weight: 80g
Found In: Dry, open savannahs and low lands.

name: Red-billed hornbill
description:
The red-billed hornbill has gray to brown-black plumage, lighter markings on its wings, and a bright red bill with little to no casque (horny projections).
Length: 46cm
Weight: 500g
Found In: Tree and bush savannas.

name: Red-billed toucan
description:
The red-billed toucan is black with a white throat. It has a red bill with a yellow border.
Length: 55cm
Weight: 600g
Found In: Tropical rainforest.

name: Red-billed tropic bird
description:
The red-billed tropic bird is white with a black patch over its eye. The central tail feathers are elongated, and the wingtips are black. Both the back and the wings are barred.
Length: 90-105cm
Weight: 750g
Found In: Offshore islands, open seas.

name: Red-breasted nuthatch
description:
The red-breasted nuthatch has blue-gray upperparts and pale rusty undersides. The male has a black crown and a line through its eye. The female has a gray crown.
Length: 11-12cm
Weight: 10g
Found In: Mixed forests.

name: Red-capped cardinal
description:
Red-capped cardinals have a black bill with the base of the mandible a yellowish flesh color. The head and chin are crimson red with a black smudge around the eye. The upperparts are glossy blue black and the underparts are white. The immature red-capped cardinals have a brown head, chin, and upperparts and white underparts.
Length: 16.5-18cm
Weight: 22g
Found In: Open forest, gallery forest, second growth, marshes, scrubs, and near water up to 300 meters.

name: Red-cheeked cordon bleu
description:
The male red-cheeked cordon bleu has a red spot on its cheeks, a short pink bill, and light brown or pink-brown legs. The female looks similar but is paler in color.
Length: 13cm
Weight: 10g
Found In: Acacia savannas, thorn, scrub, dry bush.

name: Red-headed woodpecker
description:
The entire head of the red-headed woodpecker is red. The wings and tail are blue-black in color, the wing patches are white, and the underparts and rump are white.
Length: 25cm
Weight: 72g
Found In: Groves, farms, orchards, urban areas.

name: Red-knobbed coot
description:
The red-knobbed coot is sooty black in color, and the bill is white with a bluish tinge. There are also two swollen red knobs at the top of the frontal shield when breeding.
Length: 28-42cm
Weight: 600-1100g
Found In: Marshes, freshwater lakes.

name: Red-legged pademelon
description:
The red-legged pademelon is gray-brown above and cream-colored below. Its cheeks, forearms, and hind legs are rufous-brown.
Length: Male 47-54cm, female 39-52cm
Weight: Male 3.7-6.8kg, female 2.5-4.2kg
Found In: Rainforest, mixed savanna, wet forests.

name: Red-necked phalarope
description:
The red-necked phalarope has gray upperparts with a thin white stripe on its wing and a black eye patch. The legs of the red-necked phalarope are long and black. The female in breeding condition has a white throat with a lower red border.
Length: 18cm
Weight: 40-48g

name: Red-necked wallaby
description:
The red-necked wallaby has silver-tipped gray fur, rust red shoulders and upper back, and a pale face and thigh stripes.
Length: 82cm
Weight: 15kg
Found In: Eucalypt forest.

name: Red-shouldered glossy starling
description:
The head of the red-shouldered glossy starling is a glossy steel blue. It has a glossy violet-blue tail, and other areas are glossy green-blue. The starling has orange eyes.
Length: 25cm
Weight: 100g
Found In: Acacia thornveld.

name: Red-tailed cockatoo
description:
The male red-tailed cockatoo is black with red patches on its tail. The female, however, is brown-black with yellow spotting, and the feathers of the breast and abdomen are black with orange-yellow edges. Her tail is orange and barred with black.
Length: 60cm
Weight: 720g
Found In: Woodland and agricultural areas.

name: Red-tailed hawk
description:
The red-tailed hawk has broad wings, a dark patagial mark on the underwings, and a brick red tail. The light morph includes a brown head, nape, back, and upperwings. The belly band is dark, and the underwings are white with dark edgings. The dark morph includes dark underparts, upperparts, and underwings. The undersides are pale of primary and secondary flight feathers.
Length: 46cm
Weight: 1.1kg
Found In: Deserts, forests, mountains.

name: Red-tailed wambenger
description:
The red-tailed wambenger has ashy gray upperparts, white/cream underparts, a darker patch in front of the eye, and reddish ears and tail base. The wambenger has black hairs at the end of the tail.
Length: 93-122mm
Weight: 38-68g
Found In: Forests with tall, dense vegetation.

name: Red-winged blackbird
description:
The male red-winged blackbird has black feathers with a bright red patch bordered by yellow on the wings. The female blackbird is brown with white upperparts and streaked underparts.
Length: 18-24cm
Weight: 41-70g
Found In: Wetlands.

name: Rhesus macaque
description:
The rhesus macaque has a brown coat with paler undersides. Its face and rump are red and naked.
Length: 47-64cm
Weight: 5.4-7.7kg
Found In: Forests, urban areas.

name: Richardson's ground squirrel
description:
Richardson's ground squirrel is yellow-brown to gray in color.
Length: 243-337mm
Weight: 330g
Found In: Short grass prairies.

name: Ring dove
description:
The ring dove has gray plumage, a white band across its wings, a white patch on the sides of its neck, a dark tail band, and a pinkish-brown breast and neck.
Length: 30cm
Weight: 140g
Found In: Wooded country, farmlands, parks and gardens.

name: Ring-necked pheasant
description:
The ring-necked pheasant has a long, pointed tail. The male has a red eye patch, a green head, a white neck ring, and a brown and russet patterned body. The female is a mottled sandy-brown color.
Length: 76-91cm
Weight: 1kg
Found In: Farmland, marsh edges, brushland.

name: Ring-tailed coatimundi
description:
The ring-tailed coatimundi is tawny red with a black face, white spots above and below each eye and cheek, and a white throat and belly. Its feet are black, and the tail has black rings.
Length: 80-130cm
Weight: 3.5-5.6kg
Found In: Tropical lowlands, dry high-altitude forests, oak forests, mesquite grasslands.

name: Ring-tailed gecko
description: N/A

name: Ring-tailed lemur
description:
The ring-tailed lemur has a gray back with paler limbs and belly. Its extremities are white. The top of the head, the eye rings, and the muzzle are black. The tail of this lemur is ringed with black and white.
Length: 39-46cm
Weight: 2.3-3.5kg
Found In: Deciduous forests.

name: Ring-tailed possum
description:
The ring-tailed possum has white patches behind its ears extending to the tip of its tail.
Length: 300-350cm
Weight: 700-1100g
Found In: Areas with a variety of vegetation.

name: Ringtail
locations: Western parts of Central North America
description:
The ringtail cat has a gray or brown coat with white spots above and below the eyes and on the cheeks. The tail has black and white rings.
Length: 31-38cm
Weight: 800-1100g
Found In: Dry, rocky areas.

name: Roan antelope
description:
The coat color of the roan antelope varies from sandy fawn to dark red. The undersides are white, and the face markings are black and white. This antelope has long ear tufts, a stiff mane, and horns that curve backward.
Length: 190-240cm
Height: 126-145cm
Weight: 260-280kg
Found In: Open woodlands, dry bush, savannas near water.

name: Rock dove
description:
The rock dove can be a variety of colors from gray to black or even reddish-brown. It has a white rump patch, two black bars across the inner wing, and the under wing is mostly white.
Length: 31-34cm
Weight: 360g
Found In: Open areas, urban areas.

name: Roe deer
description:
The summer coat of the roe deer is red with a gray face. The chin is white, and there is a black band from the mouth to the nostrils. The winter coat is fawn-colored with a white rump patch and throat. This deer has little to no tail.
Length: 130cm
Height: 64-89cm
Weight: 17-23kg
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Rose-ringed parakeet
description:
The feathers of the rose-ringed parakeet are light green. The males have a rose-colored ring around their neck. The chin is black, turquoise, and rose in color, and the central tail feather is blue.
Length: 41cm
Weight: 130g

name: Royal tern
description:
The royal tern has a black face mask, a white forehead and crown, and a spiky crest at the rear of the head. The royal tern also has white ring around its eyes and a deeply forked tail.
Length: 46cm
Weight: 350-450g
Found In: Coasts, sandy beaches, salt bays.

name: Rufous-collared sparrow
description:
The rufous-collared sparrow has a brown back with black streaking and a broad, rufous nape.
Length: 13.5-15cm
Weight: 20-25g
Found In: Highlands (600 to 3000m), urban and suburban areas.

name: Sable antelope
description:
The female sable antelope is russet with paler underparts. The male is black with white underparts and scythe-like horns.
Length: 197-210cm
Height: 117-140cm
Weight: 220-260kg
Found In: Woodlands, grassland edges.

name: Sacred ibis
description:
The sacred ibis has a white body with black feathers forming a loose net around its back, wings, and tail. The ibis has black skin on its head, neck, legs, and feet. Its beak is slender and curved.
Height: 61cm
Weight: 1.4kg
Found In: Marshes, shores.

name: Saddle-billed stork
description:
The saddlebill stork is a large black and white stork with a red, black, and yellow saddle. Its neck, head, and legs are black, and it has a naked red patch on its breast.
Length: 152cm
Weight: 6kg
Found In: Rivers and marshes.

name: Sally lightfoot crab
description:
The sally lightfoot crab has a red dorsal side and a bright blue belly.
Length: 3.8-8.9cm
Found In: Rocky shores.

name: Sockeye salmon
description:
The breeding male sockeye salmons have bright red skin on their back and sides. Also, their backs are humped and their jaws are hooked. The pre-spawning adults are metallic green/blue with silver sides and a white belly.
Length: up to 84cm
Weight: 1.8-3.6kg
Found In: Open seas, coastal waters, rivers and lakes.

name: Sambar
description:
The sambar has a dark brown coat with light yellow/brown patches under its chin, inside its limbs, and under its tail.
Height: 61-142cm
Weight: 227-272kg
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Sandhill crane
description:
The plumage of the sandhill crane is mostly gray with a red forehead. The neck and legs are long.
Height: 86-122cm
Weight: 3.2-5.2kg
Found In: Freshwater marshes, ponds, tundra, prairies.

name: Spotted sandpiper
description:
The spotted sandpiper has a long straight bill, a long broad supercilium, dark brown upper parts with faint buffish speckles, and a lightly streaked fore neck and upper breast. The wings do not have a bar. The legs are a pale greenish yellow color.
Length: 18-21cm
Weight: 34g
Found In: Freshwater ponds, streams, estuaries.

name: Sarus crane
description:
The sarus crane is gray with white wings, a pale crown and ear patch, and bare red skin on the head and upper neck.
Height: 183cm
Weight: 7kg
Found In: Seasonally flooded grassy plains, clearings surrounded by forests.

name: Scaly-breasted lorikeet
description:
The scaly-breasted lorikeet is dark green with hints of blue on the crown and sides of the head. The throat, breast, neck, and mantle are yellow with a green edging. The underwing coverts and tail band are red.
Length: 24cm
Weight: 87g
Found In: Coastal open forests.

name: Scarlet macaw
description:
The scarlet macaw is bright scarlet with unfeathered white facial skin. Its wings are yellow and blue with hints of green. The greater and median wing coverts are yellow, and the primaries and secondaries are blue. The macaw's underwing coverts are red, the rump and lower back are blue, and the tail is red with a blue tip.
Length: 85cm
Weight: 1kg
Found In: Tropical rainforests.

name: Scottish highland cow
description:
The shaggy coat, wavy red hair, and handlebar horns are unique to the Scottish highland cow. Their eyes are often covered with hair. These cows also come in black, yellow, dun, and silver.
Length: 104-112cm
Weight: 325kg

name: Southern elephant seal
description:
The Southern elephant seal is dark silver in color. Males have a thick neck shield and large pendulous proboscis on their nose.
Length: Male 490cm, female 300cm
Weight: Male 2400kg, female 680kg
Found In: Oceans, coasts, ice packs.

name: Secretary bird
description:
The secretary bird is light gray with black wingtips, tail, and thighs. The head has a crest of long feathers, the legs and tail are long, and the facial skin is red and yellow.
Length: 150cm
Height: 101cm
Weight: 3-4kg
Found In: Open grasslands.

name: Serval
description:
The serval is orange-brown with black spots. It has very long and slender legs and large rounded ears on a small head.
Length: 65-90cm
Weight: 13.5-19kg
Found In: Savannas, open plains, woodlands.

name: Seven-banded armadillo
description:
The body of the seven-banded armadillo is entirely covered in cornfield plates. They usually have 6-7 mobile bands. Occasionally, there are eight mobile bands, attached to the pelvic shield and only mobile at the sides. The armor of the seven-banded armadillo is darker at the sides than the nine-banded species.
Length: 20-30.5cm
Weight: 1.45-1.8kg
Found In: Open grasslands.

name: Snowy sheathbill
description:
The snowy sheathbill is white with a yellow, conical bill and pink facial skin.
Length: 35cm
Found In: Coastal plains, rocky and sandy intertidal zones, occasionally ice floes.

name: Short-beaked echidna
description:
The coat of the short-beaked echidna is black to light. It has spines on its back and sides, and the snout is long, narrow, and naked.
Length: 30-45cm
Weight: 3.5-8kg
Found In: Grasslands, forests.

name: Short-nosed bandicoot
description:
The short-nosed bandicoot is dark brown in color with paler undersides.
Length: 30-35cm
Found In: Scrub forests, areas with low ground cover.

name: Southern white-crowned shrike
description:
The top of the head and the back of the neck of the southern white-crowned shrike are white. The chin and breast are white, and the sides of the neck are black. The back and belly of the shrike are ash-brown, and the wings and tail are dark brown.
Length: 24cm
Weight: 70g
Found In: Open bushlands.

name: Sidewinder
description:
The skin of the sidewinder is lightly colored with darker patches and a dark eye stripe along the sides of the head. The scales are keeled, and the head has supraocular scales that are upturned and pointed.
Length: 46-81cm
Found In: Deserts.

name: Silver gull
description:
The head, body, and tail of the silver gull are white. The mantle, back, and wings are gray in color. This gull also has a red bill.
Length: 43cm
Found In: Coastal waters, inland lakes, sandy and rocky shores.

name: Striped skunk
description:
The striped skunk is easily distinguished by its black coat with white stripes forking down the back and tail. It also has a white patch on its head.
Length: 68cm
Weight: 1.5-3kg
Found In: Semi open country, woods, grasslands, suburbia.

name: Slender loris
description:
The fur of the slender loris is gray or reddish in color. Its eyes are surrounded by black, and there is a white stripe running down its nose.
Length: 18-26cm
Weight: 300g
Interesting Fact: Both of the thumbs and great toes are opposable to aid in grasping limbs.
Found In: Rainforests, open woodlands, swamp forests.

name: Sloth bear
description:
The sloth bear has long shaggy black fur with a white/chestnut chest mark and a whitish muzzle.
Length: 1.5-1.9m
Height: 60-90cm
Weight: 90-115kg
Found In: Lowland forests.

name: Small Indian mongoose
description:
The small Indian mongoose is either light brown-gray and darkly speckled or red with black speckling.
Length: 39cm
Weight: 800g
Found In: Arid regions, wet tropics.

name: Small-clawed otter
description:
The coat of the small-clawed otter can vary from burnt umber to dusky brown in color. Its throat is lighter colored, and its feet are webbed to allow for agility in the water.
Length: 41-64cm
Weight: 4.5kg
Found In: Freshwater wetlands, mangrove swamps.

name: Small spotted genet
description:
The small-spotted genet has a white to brown-gray body with rows of darker spots along its back. The tail has dark bars, and the muzzle is pointed.
Length: 50-60cm
Weight: 2kg
Found In: Semi deserts, scrublands, savannas.

name: Small-toothed palm civet
description:
The small-toothed palm civet can be silver, buff, or dark-brown in color. It has three thin, dark stripes running down its back and a white streak in the middle of its nose.
Length: 51cm
Weight: 2.4kg
Found In: Dense forests.

name: Snow goose
description:
The snow goose has white feathers with black wingtips and a pinkish bill.
Length: 65-84cm
Weight: 3.5kg
Found In: Lakes and swamps in Arctic tundra.

name: Snowy egret
description:
The snowy egret has white plumage, a slender black bill, black legs, and yellow feet.
Length: 51-69cm
Weight: 370g
Found In: Marshes, swamps, ponds, shores.

name: Snowy owl
description:
The snowy owl has mostly white feathers with dark-barred markings, and females tend to have more barring. The owl has a black bill, feathered feet, and black tail bands.
Length: 52-65cm
Weight: 1.7kg
Found In: Tundra, marshes, coasts.

name: Sociable weaver
description:
The sociable weaver is dull brown with a black face mask, a bluish bill and back, and its wings are patterned with black spots.
Length: 14cm
Weight: 30g
Found In: Dry thorn country.

name: South African hedgehog
description:
The South African hedgehog is a dark chocolate brown color with black banded quills and a white band of fur across its forehead. Its belly fur is gray-brown.
Length: 18-25cm
Weight: 300-700g
Found In: Open, dry or seasonal habitat with sparse or patchy grass cover, especially overgrazed areas.

name: South American sea lion
locations: Eastern Southern coast of South America
description:
The coat coloration of the Southern sea lion can vary. Males have a pale mane and an upturned nose.
Length: Male 256cm, female 200cm
Weight: Male 300-340kg, female 144kg
Found In: Oceans, coasts, offshore islands.

name: Southern black-backed gull
description:
The plumage of the Southern black-backed gull is white. The upper wing and saddle are black with white tips. This gull has a yellow bill with a red spot at the tip.
Length: 55cm
Weight: 900g
Found In: Beaches, rocky areas, grasslands, ledges, glacial islets.

name: Southern boubou
description:
The top of the head, sides of the face, back, and tail of the Southern boubou are black. Its rump is buff, and its wings are black with a white band. The boubou's chin and breast are white. The lower belly and flanks are cinnamon-buff in color.
Length: 22cm
Weight: 50g
Found In: Bushlands near water, areas with dense cover, mountain slopes.

name: Southern ground hornbill
description:
The Southern ground hornbill is black with white primaries. It has a throat patch that is bare and inflatable. The male's throat patch is red, and the female's is violet-blue.
Length: 90-100cm
Weight: 3-4kg
Found In: Savannas, woodlands, grasslands.

name: Southern hairy-nosed wombat
description:
The Southern hairy-nosed wombat has gray-brown fur, a broad blunt head, and short muscular legs.
Length: 75-95cm
Height: 30cm
Weight: 18-32kg
Found In: Semiarid and arid zones, plains, open woodlands, shrublands.

name: Southern lapwing
description:
The chest, cravat, and crest of the Southern lapwing are black. It has a grayish-brown back with a coppery shine, red eyes, a pink beak, a sharp wing spur, and black and white under wings and tail.
Length: 35cm
Found In: Pastures, marshes, lake beds, steppes.

name: Southern right whale
locations: Temperate ocean waters of both hemispheres
description:
The southern right whale has black skin with white patches on its chin and belly. The head and jaw are usually covered with large skin callosities of parasites (barnacles, worms, and whale lice).
Length: 5-18m
Weight: 50-56 metric tons
Found In: Temperate oceans.

name: Southern tamandua
description:
The coat color of the tamandua varies from blonde to brown with a black 'vest' from the shoulder to the rump. The underside and tail tip are naked, and the snout is elongated. The tail of the tamandua is prehensile.
Length: 47-76cm
Weight: 1.8-6.8kg
Found In: Tropical forests, savannas.

name: Spectacled caiman
description:
The spectacled caiman is brown, yellow-tan, or olive green in color with dark bands crossing its body and tail.
Length: 243cm
Weight: 29.5kg
Found In: Ponds, lakes, rivers, marshes, swamps.

name: Sportive lemur
description:
The sportive lemur has dense woolly fur. Their legs are longer than their arms, and their tail is shorter than their body.
Length: 24-30cm
Weight: 500-1000g
Found In: Forests.

name: Spotted hyena
description:
The short coat of the spotted hyena can be dirty yellow or red in color with dark brown spots. They have a short erectile mane, and their tails have a long black brush at the end of them. Hyenas are also known for their sloping back.
Length: 120-140cm
Height: 70-90cm
Weight: 50-80kg
Found In: Grasslands, flat open terrain.

name: Springbok
description:
The coat coloration of the springbok is reddish-fawn with white underparts, face, and rump. There are dark bands on the sides of the body running from the eye to the muzzle. A line of white erectile hairs are along the lower back.
Length: 96-115cm
Height: 75-83cm
Weight: 25-46kg
Found In: Treeless grasslands (velds).

name: Springhare
description:
The coat of the springhare varies from yellow-brown to rufous-brown. The tips of the ears and tail are black, and the underside is lighter. The springhare is often referred to as a mini kangaroo.
Length: 36-43cm
Weight: 4kg
Found In: Floodplains; semiarid, sparsely-vegetated areas.

name: Spur-winged goose
description:
The male spur-winged goose has a red face with no feathers, a black crown and nape, a brown neck, and a white throat, breast, and cheeks. The sides, wings, and tail of the spur-winged goose are black with a purple and green gloss. The spur-winged goose also has white undersides, a pink bill and legs, and a sharp spur at the bend of each wing that is only visible during flight.
Length: 75-115cm
Weight: 4-9kg
Found In: Flooded meadows, swamps and lakes.

name: Square-lipped rhinoceros
description:
The square-lipped rhinoceros is neutral gray and nearly hairless. It has a broad, squared upper lip. There are two horns on the face with a shorter posterior horn. The longer anterior horns can be up to 166 cm in length.
Length: Male 370-400cm, female 340-365cm
Height: Male 170-186cm, female 160-177cm
Weight: Male 2300kg, female 1700kg
Found In: Savannas, open woodlands.

name: Squirrel glider
description:
The fur of the squirrel glider varies from blue to brown shades of gray. There is a dark dorsal stripe from the eyes to the mid-back, distinct facial markings, and cream-colored undersides.
Length: 180-230mm
Weight: 190-300g
Found In: Dry forests, woodlands, rainforests.

name: Stanley bustard
description:
The Stanley bustard has a black cap, a dark brown back, and chestnut on the back of their neck. The underside of their neck and breast are bluish-gray, and the belly is white in color. The wings of the bustard are black with white markings.
Length: 84-116cm
Weight: 7-10kg
Found In: Dried swamps, grasslands.

name: Superb starling
description:
The exact color and markings of the superb starling can vary. However, they are usually a glossy black/blue/green color with white eyes. It has a white breast band and a chestnut breast and stomach.
Length: 17cm
Weight: 80g
Found In: Woodlands, thorny bush, acacia country, urban areas.

name: Steenbok
description:
The steenbok has a reddish-fawn coat with white-lined ears.
Length: 70-95cm
Height: 45-60cm
Weight: 10-15kg
Found In: Lightly wooded plains.

name: Stick insect
description:
Walking sticks have stick-like bodies, spindly legs and are green gray or brown in color.
Length: 5-30cm
Found In: Tropical areas and forests, usually in trees or bushes.

name: Stone sheep
description:
The coat of the stone sheep is black or gray with a large, distinct rump patch. Males have large, curved spiral horns.
Length: 135-155cm
Height: 93-102cm
Weight: 90-120kg
Found In: Mountain slopes with few trees, rugged terrain, meadows.

name: Striped dolphin
locations: All tropical, subtropical and warm temperate waters
description:
The possible colors of the striped dolphin include dark gray, brown, or blue. The flanks are a light gray color, the flippers are black, and the belly is white. This dolphin also has black bands extending from the eyes to the anal area and from the eyes to the flippers.
Length: 2.4m
Weight: 100kg
Found In: Deep offshore waters.

name: Striped hyena
description:
The striped hyena is gray or yellowish-gray in color with black stripes on its body and legs. The muzzle, throat, and neck are black. This hyena also has a long, erectile mane down its back.
Length: 99-122cm
Weight: 30-40kg
Found In: Dry savannas, bush country, semi deserts, deserts.

name: Sugar glider
description:
The sugar glider is blue-gray to brown-gray on its back and sides. It has a dark mid-dorsal stripe, a cream to pale gray underside, and a tail that can be gray to black in color.
Length: 160-210mm
Weight: 95-160g
Found In: Open forests.

name: Sulfur-crested cockatoo
description:
The sulfur-crested cockatoo is mostly white with a bright yellow crest on its head.
Length: 50cm
Weight: 700-950g
Found In: Forests, savannas, farmland.

name: Sungazer
description:
The sungazer has a dark brown back, paler flanks (sometimes orange-tan), and sharp pointed scales on the neck and tail.
Length: 38cm
Found In: Grasslands.

name: Swainson's francolin
description:
Swainson's francolin is dark brown above with black markings. The nape, sides of the face, neck, and underparts are paler in comparison. The upper mandible is black and the lower is reddish. The bare facial skin of the francolin is red, and the legs are black. The males are spurred.
Length: 41cm
Found In: Bushvelds, near water.

name: Swallow-tailed gull
description:
The head of the swallow-tailed gull is dark gray to black. There is a white stripe across the upper portion of the bill, and there are red rings around the eyes.
Length: 51-61cm
Weight: 610-780g
Found In: Wet costal areas, dry costal areas, Scalesia zone, Miconia zone, ocean.

name: Swamp deer
description:
The swamp deer is brown with yellowish undersides. Males may have a reddish tone during the warmer seasons.
Length: 119-124cm
Weight: 172-182kg
Found In: Swamps, grass areas close to water, forests.

name: Tailless tenrec
description:
The tailless tenrec has stiff hairs and spines of various shades of brown.
Length: 27-39cm
Weight: 1-2kg
Found In: Brushlands, dry forest clearings, highland plateaus.

name: Tarantula
description:
The tarantula's body is tan to black in color. It has two large fangs.
Length: 2.5-12cm
Weight: 30-90g
Found In: Dry areas.

name: Tasmanian devil
description:
The Tasmanian devil has black fur with white marks on the chest and rump.
Length: 57-65cm
Weight: 7-9kg
Found In: All major habitats.

name: Tawny eagle
description:
The tawny eagle is red-brown to yellow-buff in color. It lacks any conspicuous markings.
Length: 65-75cm
Weight: 2-2.5kg
Found In: Forested mountains, valleys, plains.

name: Tawny frogmouth
description:
The tawny frogmouth has a broad gray bill, a flat crown, and a yellow gape and eyes. Above, the frogmouth is gray to red-brown and is streaked with black. Its undersides are pale in comparison.
Length: 34-48cm
Weight: 680g
Found In: Woodlands.

name: Tayra
description:
The tayra is dark brown to black in color. It has a yellow or white patch on its throat
Length: 90-115cm
Weight: 4-6kg
Found In: Forests.

name: Thirteen-lined squirrel
description:
The thirteen-lined squirrel has thirteen alternating light and dark stripes running down its back. There are also lighter spots within the dark stripes, and the sides and belly are buff-colored.
Length: 285mm
Weight: 154-160g
Found In: Short grass prairies.

name: Thomson's gazelle
description:
Thomson's gazelle has bright fawn upperparts, dark bands on the sides and on the face, and a paler underside. The horns are much larger on the male than on the female.
Length: 80-107cm
Height: 55-65cm
Weight: 15-20kg
Found In: Open plains with short grass.

name: Three-banded plover
description:
The three-banded plover has a double dark breast band, a red eye ring, a pinkish bill base and legs, and a gray face and throat. The cap and wings are dark, and the undersides and wingbar are white.
Length: 17-18cm
Weight: 30g
Found In: Rivers, lakes, wetlands, coastal lagoons.

name: Tiger
description:
The exact physical characteristics of the tiger varies by subspecies. Most, however, have a reddish-orange to light orange coat; but some may be white. All species have black stripes.
Length: 2.2-3.1m
Height: 91cm
Weight: 100-260kg
Found In: Several forest types, mangrove swamps.

name: Tiger cat
description:
The tiger cat is dimorphic, which means it occurs in two distinct forms. It is a rich brown color with white spots on the top, paler underparts, and a spotted tail.
Length: 350-759mm
Weight: 4-7kg
Found In: Rainforests, open forests, woodlands, coastal and inland areas.

name: Tiger snake
description:
The tiger snake has a flat body, a short flat head, and large eyes with vertical yellow pupils. The body colors include yellow, orange, or reddish-brown. This snake has a dark band across its neck, a series of dark bands down the back, and a pale yellow underside.
Length: 38-61cm
Found In: Rocky arid regions, moist savannas, low forests.

name: Timber wolf
description:
The timber wolf has gray-brown fur with light tan underparts.
Length: 152-168cm
Height: 76cm
Weight: 23-45kg
Found In: Forest, taiga, tundra, plains, mountains, deserts.

name: Tokay gecko
description:
The tokay gecko is gray with brownish-red to red spots. The male is more brightly colored. The toes have fine bristles used for gripping.
Length: 28cm
Weight: 300g
Interesting Fact:Some cultures believe that tokay geckos bring good luck to a person's home.
Found In: In or near houses, tropical rain forests.

name: Topi
description:
The topi is tan to deep red-brown and has a very glossy coat. The shoulders and rump are black, undersides and shoulder hump are tan, and there is a black tuft at the tip of the tail. It has a black face, and both sexes have horns.
Length: 150-205cm
Height: 100-130cm
Weight: 75-160kg
Found In: Savannas, flood plains, semi deserts.

name: Trumpeter swan
locations: Western portions of Northern and Central North America
description:
The trumpeter swan has white feathers, and a black bill, legs, and feet.
Length: 114cm
Weight: Males 11.9kg, females 9.4kg
Found In: Lakes, ponds, large rivers, bays, grain fields.

name: Turkey vulture
description:
The feathers on the body of the turkey vulture are dark brown. The head is red and unfeathered, the bill is yellow, and the legs are red.
Length: 63.5cm
Weight: 1.5kg
Found In: Scrub vegetation, semi-deserts, open landscapes.

name: Turtle
description:
The colorations of the turtle varies by species.
Found In: Dry steppe, deserts, mountains, rivers and lakes, ponds, swamps, marine regions.

name: Two-toed sloth
description:
The two-toed sloth is grayish-brown with a pale face. Its fur often has a greenish tint due to algal growth.
Length: 61cm
Weight: 5.7kg
Found In: Tropical forests.

name: Tyrant flycatcher
description:
The dusky flycatcher has a gray back with an olive tinge. It also has a light throat with a yellow belly.
Length: 13-15cm
Weight: 20-40g
Found In: Woodlands, deserts, meadows, and mountain chaparral.

name: Uinta ground squirrel
description:
The Uinta ground squirrel is brown to buff above and has buff undersides. The top of the head, sides of the face, and neck are gray.
Length: 28-29cm
Weight: 300-400g
Found In: Sagegrass mountain meadows, valley pastures, cultivated areas and lawns.

name: Urial
description:
The urial is light brown in color, and males have white cheek beards and a long neck ruff.
Length: 110-145cm
Height: 88-100cm
Weight: 36-87kg
Found In: Hills and mountains.

name: Verreaux's sifaka
description:
The Verreaux's sifaka has a long, thick coat that is primarily white with a dark brown crown. The face and muzzle are black, the eyes are yellow, and the undersides often appear darker.
Length: 400-475cm
Weight: 3-4kg
Found In: Dry deciduous forests.

name: Vervet monkey
description:
Vervet monkeys have black faces, white whiskers, and a gray to yellow coat. Males have a blue-green hue.
Length: 40-80cm
Weight: Males 4-8kg, females 3-5.5kg
Interesting Fact: The vervet monkey is the most widely distributed monkey in Africa.
Found In: Savannas, edges of woodlands.

name: Vicuna
description:
The vicuna has a tawny brown coat that is thick and woolly and white undersides.
Length: 137-160cm
Weight: 35-65kg
Found In: Semiarid grasslands above 3900m

name: Vine snake
description:
The vine snake is very slender and can be gray, green, brown, or yellow in color. This snake may also have stripes.
Length: up to 1.3m
Found In: Tropical forests, urban and rural areas.

name: Violet-crested turaco
description:
The violet-crested turaco has a dark purple crest, an olive green neck, red eye rings, and a black bill. The chest color may be green or chestnut. The body is a glossy purple color, and the flight feathers are bright red.
Length: 43-46cm
Weight: 25g
Interesting Fact: Northern populations have a green chest, while southern birds have a chestnut-colored chest.
Found In: Evergreen forests, plantations, urban areas.

name: Whip-tailed wallaby
description:
The whip-tailed wallaby has short, brown-gray hair, white undersides, a white stripe on its upper lip, and a light brown stripe running down its neck and shoulders. This wallaby also has a white hip stripe.
Length: 75.5-92.4cm
Weight: 7-26kg
Interesting Fact: When they are alarmed, whiptail wallabies stamp their feet.
Found In: Inland plains to tropical rainforests.

name: Warthog
description:
The warthog has a large head with a broad muzzle. It has two wart-like bumps on its nose. The coat is bristly with little hair, and the warthog has two tusks and a mane down the middle of its back.
Length: 107-137cm
Weight: Male 60-150kg, female 45-75kg
Interesting Fact: Warthogs have a greater tolerance for heat than the other pigs of Africa.
Found In: Savannas, treeless open plain.

name: Water leguaan
description:
The water leguaan is dark brown or black with yellow spots on its undersides and black bands lined with yellow behind each eye. The neck is long, and the leguaan's nose is elongated. There is a dorsal keel on the tail, and the scales are keeled.
Length: 3m
Weight: 1-3kg
Interesting Fact: Water legaans can remain underwater for 30 minutes.
Found In: Waterways in heavily forested areas.

name: Water moccasin
description:
The colors of the water moccasin include brown, olive, and black. The underside is yellow, and the body has cross bands that encircle the entire body. The inner surface of the mouth is white.
Length: 50-190cm
Interesting Fact: This is the only species of poisonous water snake in North America.
Found In: Marshes, streams, lakes, swamps.

name: Wattled crane
description:
The wattled crane has two white-feathered wattles on either side of its bill. Its neck is long and white, and the wings and back are gray. The bird's undersides are black.
Height: 150-175cm
Weight: 9kg
Found In: Shallow wetlands.

name: Waved albatross
locations: Central parts of Western South America
description:
The waved albatross has black wings and saddle, white plumage, and an orange hooked bill. The feet are blue in color.
Length: 80-90cm
Weight: 3-5kg
Found In: Oceans, coasts, coastal islands.

name: White-browed sparrow-weaver
description:
The crown, lores, and mustache of the white-browed sparrow-weaver are black. Its eyebrows, rump, and uppertail coverts are white. Overall, the white-browed sparrow is light brown in color with white tips on its upperwing coverts and whitish undersides.
Length: 18cm
Weight: 50g
Interesting Fact: When a nest is being used for roosting, it has two entrances. When it is being used for breeding, one of the entrances is blocked.
Found In: Dry acacia velds, with isolated patches of larger trees.

name: Weeper capuchin
description:
The weeper capuchin has a coarse brown coat, tufts of hair on its head, and white markings throughout.
Length: 38-46cm
Weight: 2.1-2.9kg
Found In: Rainforests, forests, woodlands.

name: Western bearded dragon
description:
The coloration of the Western bearded dragon varies from black to mottled patterns of spots. It also has a scaly pouch under its lower jaw that resembles a beard.
Length: 61cm
Weight: 350-600g
Interesting Fact: The 'beard' changes colors, depending on the lizard's mood.
Found In: Outback, semi deserts, deserts.

name: Western lowland gorilla
description:
The Western lowland gorilla has a dark black coat; adult males have a silver saddle on their back.
Height: 1.4-1.8m
Weight: 90-180kg
Interesting Fact: Gorillas are the most sexually dimorphic of all primate species, with the males being twice as large as the females.
Found In: Tropical forests.

name: Western patch-nosed snake
description:
The western patch-nosed snake has a large rostral scale on the tip of its nose, a yellowish stripe with darker borders down the center of its back, and one dark stripe down each side. The underbelly is a paler color.
Length: 107cm
Weight: 600g
Found In: Lowland deserts, bush flats, desert scrub, grasslands, lower mountain slopes, woodlands.

name: Western pygmy possum
description:
The western pygmy possum is fawn to reddish brown in color with white underparts. The tail is prehensile and naked, except for the very base.
Length: 71-106mm
Weight: 8-20g
Interesting Fact: The tail is used for fat storage.
Found In: Dry sclerophyll forests, mallee heath.

name: Western spotted skunk
locations: Western parts of Southern North America
description:
The Western spotted skunk is mostly black with variable white spots and stripes on its body.
Length: 23-34cm
Weight: 600g
Interesting Fact: A skunk's spray can cause intense irritation of the eyes and temporary blindness.
Found In: Wastelands, brush, wooded areas.

name: White spoonbill
description:
The white spoonbill has white plumage and a tawny-yellow breast in its breeding season. It has a black colored bill that is tipped with yellow. The bill is flattened and spoon-shaped, hence its name.
